sqls.sql: create table iphone_questions("id" INT(11),"ex_app_id" INT(11),"name" VARCHAR(255),"difficulty" INT(2),"text_block1a" TEXT,"text_block1b" TEXT,"text_block1c" TEXT,"text_block1d" TEXT,"image" VARCHAR(255),"question_stem_a" TEXT,"question_stem_b" TEXT,"question_stem_c" TEXT,"question_stem_d" TEXT,"answer1_a" TEXT,"answer2_a" TEXT,"answer3_a" TEXT,"answer4_a" TEXT,"answer5_a" TEXT,"answer6_a" TEXT,"answer1_b" TEXT,"answer2_b" TEXT,"answer3_b" TEXT,"answer4_b" TEXT,"answer5_b" TEXT,"answer1_c" TEXT,"answer2_c" TEXT,"answer3_c" TEXT,"answer4_c" TEXT,"answer5_c" TEXT,"answer1_d" TEXT,"answer2_d" TEXT,"answer3_d" TEXT,"answer4_d" TEXT,"answer5_d" TEXT,"hint1" TEXT,"video2" TEXT,"video1" TEXT,"solution" VARCHAR(50),"solution_text" TEXT,"solution_text1" TEXT,"solution_text2" TEXT,"solution_text3" TEXT,"solution_text4" TEXT,"solution_text5" TEXT,"date" DATETIME,"idx" INT(5),"pt_id" INT(11),"pt_section" TINYINT(2),"pt_qid" TINYINT(4),"pt_group_first" TINYINT(4))

create table iphone_ex_apps("id" INT(11),"section" VARCHAR(255),"subsection" VARCHAR(255),"name" VARCHAR(255),"date" DATETIME,"duration" INT(5),"solving_title" VARCHAR(255),"evaluation_title" VARCHAR(255),"price" DOUBLE(11,2),"total_time" INT(11),"difficulty" INT(2),"video_url" VARCHAR(255))
create table iphone_ex_app_pages("id" INT(11),"ex_app_id" INT(11),"content" TEXT,"idx" INT(5),"date" DATETIME,"solving" TINYINT(1))

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('6901','673','If m is an even integer, then which of the following is the sum of the ... ...','null','91664b628b3c7f51ccdf3da5aed1f7f8f06a0047WlFWUFFTB1ENVQFWBl1VBwsFAFQSUlNQV1EDVwcAB1AKUQEHWVEHDA4','','','','null','24bd523d404186cf0d6bb9b8472cca4ac6bb587bAgBZAABUBFEMU1NQDA1XBF1UAVNxAhAFUlVcC11KVwtYFlBKRAUKQgRCXVgTXllBXQRSQBQVQl4BDBdBUA1TURdXBEYVDVdGAFlVVQsTDQwGFFFFE0NfUBgQQl8YWlAWEApSFlYBSE0XTBUJQQBEAwgWUFcQAQMHE0cYUUFSVkFdERdGUFRYFlBeUlsGCQwWUlVcRkpFA1lGVABbXFBTUAJXWQJSVAFXWlYPBVo','','','','   8m + 2','   8m + 4','   8m + 6','   8m + 8','   8m + 10','null','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','','','','Suppose m = 2, an even integer. Then 4m + 1 = 9, which is odd. Hence, the next even integer greater than 9 is 10. And the next even integer after 10 is 12. Now, 10 + 12 = 22. So look for an answer-choice which equals 22 when m = 2.

Begin with choice (A). Since m = 2, 8m + 2 = 18—eliminate (A). Next, 8m + 4 = 20—eliminate (B). Next, 8m + 6 = 22. Hence, the answer is (C).

','','','2011-11-18 22:03:28','0','0','0','0','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('6904','673','If p and q are positive integers, how many integers are larger than pq ... ...','null','','null','null','null','null','de0b4a2156641040c2494ebf3034512c8a5b42d5BwwHBAdbAwIHBFMEUFtQVFsBB1J9BERZVl8KRFhNAwgLGVRcURAJVQkGFw4bXV1YE1VFA0QTXhULQ1hBUUINC0dXU1EWEUpFXVZCElhRW0lEUQhGUV9VFEAUVhQBQ10HEFBURRQWDARdEghRCVwWFAkWUF8LEFReABgVX1VUXANBFEMOBQ0RWgdaD0cITQEIDRoIUQlcF1kaXFgMFRsVAk0HRgZRWlZVAwcDU1VRUl4DAlMDBgZR','null','null','null','   3 ','   p + 2 ','   p − 2 ','   2p − 1 ','   2p + 1 ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','D','null','null','null','null','Let p = 1 and q = 2. Then pq = 2 and p(q + 2) = 4. This scenario has one integer, 3, greater than pq and less than p(q + 2). Now, we plug p = 1 and q = 2 into the answer-choices until we find one that has the value 1. Look at choice (D): 2p − 1 = (2)(1) − 1 = 1. Thus, the answer is (D).

','null','2011-11-18 22:03:28','0','null','null','null','null');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('6905','673','If x and y are prime numbers, then which one of the following cannot equal ... ...','null','','null','null','null','null','ea929c60b997f06afa6e8617e50f6cf4da29ce9bB1YCVQEFVwJSBlNbAw4CCw0CBFFxB0IJAQsMSw4eVFoOEQVXABYEVQlcGl8dAwlYRldFXBdGEVBZURJaTQwAUBYVHhNGWVRZEEYMUAdeGF8KB0MMVEYQDgMWUVZbWgxOXVpVFFsADFsLEhJWQ0RQWxANAVRaThgWR1pUUQBdRB9aGVJUCQlDAQIFBVENUQQDBwAGV1MDCFRVCAY','null','null','null','   1 ','   2 ','   13 ','   14 ','   20 ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','C','null','null','null','If x = 3 and y = 2, then x − y = 3 − 2 = 1. This eliminates (A). If x = 5 and y = 3, then x − y = 5 − 3 = 2. This eliminates (B). If x = 17 and y = 3, then x − y = 17 − 3 = 14. This eliminates (D). If x = 23 and y = 3, then x − y = 23 − 3 = 20. This eliminates (E). Hence, by process of elimination, the answer is (C).

Method II (without substitution): Suppose x − y = 13. Now, let x and y be distinct prime numbers, both greater than 2. Then both x and y are odd numbers since the only even prime is 2. Hence, x = 2k + 1, and y = 2h + 1, for some positive integers k and h. And x − y = (2k + 1) − (2h + 1) = 2k − 2h = 2(k − h). Hence, x − y is even. This contradicts the assumption that x − y = 13, an odd number. Hence, x and y cannot both be greater than 2. Next, suppose y = 2, then x − y = 13 becomes x − 2 = 13. Solving yields x = 15. But 15 is not prime. Hence, there does not exist prime numbers x and y such that x − y = 13. The answer is (C).

','null','null','2011-11-18 22:03:28','0','null','null','null','null');

Then 2(x + 1) = 2(1 + 1) = 4. The next two integers greater than 4 are 5 and 6, and their product is 30. Now, check which of the answer-choices equal 30 when x = 1. Begin with (A): 4x2 + 14x + 12 = 4(1)2 + 14 · 1 + 12 = 30. No other answer-choice equals 30 when x = 1. Hence, the answer is (A).

','null','null','null','null','2011-11-18 22:03:28','0','null','null','null','null');

= ([x + 2] + 2)[x + 2] − ([x − 2] + 2)[x − 2]

= (x + 4)[x + 2] − x[x −2]

= x2 + 6x + 8 − (x2 − 2x)

= x2 + 6x + 8 − x2 + 2x

= 8x + 8

= 8(x + 1)

The answer is (E).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('6958','678','If the remainder is 1 when m is divided by 2 and the remainder is 3 when ... ...','null','','null','null','null','null','ba2e81d3b04030da2ca4e96450deea2bf09f906dBlFWUgVSBl0GCFNUDVpXAgFTVQN5VkZHWlMRRVNbWFpbU1MXRl4QEFRFQAxTXxUFV1UJWwVNU10GRQoVEFQPRVtSVFMWVEATBxdXCwIXF1gARUUBW1BcV1ZdRRZQERYDGBILA14QWlZfCF8LGVNUDRVeRUUCXhVZAQBTRFRIFQ0eGEBeUAFeEFcDQxJYVUZVXVpdWEFfV1QVWkMWEhcBVUURRRFTDhVcCw4DAwkGU1VZVwEAAAkACgIAVQ','null','null','null','   m is even. ','   n is even. ','   m + n is even. ','   mn is even. ','   m/n is even. ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','C','null','null','null','The statement “the remainder is 1 when m is divided by 2” translates into

m = 2u + 1

The statement “the remainder is 3 when n is divided by 4” translates into

n = 4v + 3

Forming the sum of m and n gives

m + n = 2u + 1 + 4v + 3 = 2u + 4v + 4 = 2(u + 2v + 2)

Since we have written m + n as a multiple of 2, it is even. The answer is (C).

Method II (Substitution)

Let m = 3 and n = 7. Then

3 = 2 · 1 + 1

and

7 = 4 · 1 + 3

Now, both 3 and 7 are odd, which eliminates (A) and (B). Further, 3 · 7 = 21 is odd, which eliminates (D). Finally, 3/7 is not an integer, which eliminates (E). Hence, by process of elimination, the answer is (C).

','null','null','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','null','null','1','null');

Hence, 5x = 5(2z) = 10z. In other words, 5x is divisible by 10. A similar analysis shows that 5y is also divisible by 10. Since 10 is the greatest number listed, the answer is (E).

','   a is odd. ','   a is zero. ','   a is positive. ','   a is negative. ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','E','null','null','null','null','null','Let a, a + 2, a + 4 stand for the consecutive even integers a, b, and c, in that order. Forming the average of a, b, and c yields

Setting this less than a/3 gives

a + 2 < a/3

Multiplying by 3 yields

3a + 6 < a

Subtracting 6 and a from both sides yields

2a < −6

Dividing by 2 yields

a < −3

Hence, a is negative, and the best answer is (E).

y ≠ 5x

and

which is prime and not odd. Hence, Statements I and III are not necessarily true. Next, let x = 3 and y = 4. Then y is not prime and

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('6965','678','If p divided by 9 leaves a remainder of 1, which of the following must ... ...','null','e44f225e7347b4e338e23fd7106007fc7e4680c9WlcCAwRbUQEDBl1WVwkDB10FU1MVVwUADlAHAAcGDldVA1IHDgkJVQA','','','','null','','','','','   I only','   II only','   III only','   I and II only','   I and III only','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','','','','First, let’s briefly review the concept of division. “Seven divided by 3 leaves a remainder of 1” means that 7 = 3 · 2 + 1. By analogy, “x divided by y leaves a remainder of 1” means that x = y · q + 1, where q is an integer.

Hence, “p divided by 9 leaves a remainder of 1” translates into p = 9 · q + 1. If q = 1, then p = 10 which is even. But if q = 2, then p = 19 which is odd. Hence, neither Statement I nor Statement II need be true. This eliminates (A), (B), (D), and (E). Hence, the answer is (C).

Let’s verify that Statement III is true. p = 9 · q + 1 = 3(3q) + 1 = 3z + 1, where z = 3q.

','','','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','0','0','8','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('6967','678','n is between 1 and 4. An integer greater than 1 is prime if it is divisible ... ...','null','5e49d9052fe32d53e27ae7f89d0b81aacafd3892U1IDV1FRCgUHVlYDBABXUwEAUFJ3D0RdXxZVU1wQEwRKAVAXVUVCR1gHDEFTElASExZACF1dFgheFg9DFggXFFULRl1KC1EPXUReDVxOQlFJRgsVEVdVBxMHXAUQCRhBbF4DF18PEFFWB0IUBQdeXVZYHgZdCUJaQ0YSEwtfXE9WUVRZCVwGAwAHB1ZVAAJQAloJBg','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','','','','','Solving the equation x2 − 5x + 6 = 0 for n gives

(x − 2)(x − 3) = 0

or

x − 2 = 0 or x − 3 = 0

Hence, x = 2 or x = 3. Although both columns have the same set of possible values (2 and 3), Column A could be 2 while Column B is 3, and visa versa. Hence, the answer is (D).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('6968','678','p and q are integers. If p is divided by 2, the remainder is 1; and if ... ...','null','3c059cbb46b96be40226f1e0fc7a3b396b1754c7UwAFVQoCAFdVUlJRDQ1TUQgAB1MIAFQOQQ5JUl1cRgdeV0YKBwkMRgwbAQ4HQVJBBEJfXU1QVQZDRR8WfQMZDFRfWEcMTQMLDhMPRUIAW0FZUAEHGQNKE1NOFkdRUBIRVFtQX1oBXEIRWxUXAVlGB15XRl8ERA5SXQoVXxYEXg1BC0UTXVxEClVTVRZWHBkGHRISX1VCFANdUg9YBgFAF1lHRFIXBwJWUQRVBFgGUFAIAFMHA1ANUwY','','','','null','','','','','   I only','   II only','   III only','   I and II only','   I and III only','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','','Statement I is true: From “If p is divided by 2, the remainder is 1,” p = 2u + 1; and from “if q is divided by 6, the remainder is 1,” q = 6v + 1. Hence, pq + 1 =

(2u + 1)(6v + 1) + 1 =

12uv + 2u + 6v + 1 + 1 =

12uv + 2u + 6v + 2 =

2(6uv + u + 3v + 1)

Since we have written pq + 1 as a multiple of 2, it is even.

Method II

Since p and q each leave a remainder of 1 when divided by an even number, both are odd. Now, the product of two odd numbers is another odd number. Hence, pq is odd, and therefore pq + 1 is even.

Now, since pq + 1 is even, pq is odd. Hence, pq/2 is not an integer, and Statement II is not necessarily true. Next, Statement III is not necessarily true. For example, if p = 3 and q = 7, then pq = 21, which is not a multiple of 12. The answer is (A).

','','','','','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','0','0','11','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('6969','678','Column A p and q are consecutive even integers, and p − 2 and q + ... ...','null','fb8e087e829428d5a05ab96cd4df0a66235301a8BQUDAwcHBFxSBgdSBltUBQtVUgYNV1gMQAoWUQgIFQQKVkFdAVoIFVoeB1gKRFZKAxYAX1wQUFRHFw0VVBJQRFVYGV0LQlACAUASTURWWABGDQdYChQLFwNbXRDQ66cXAEMFDVUSCVddCEgISlNYW0QZQVNEVkQBRlINW0cBVE0SXxVVEgZDUlxDDQ1FV1JXQkUXVlwAVgFQVgdRBQEAVlUEUQUFBQ8','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','','First, check whether p can be larger than q. Place p and q on a number line:

Then, place p − 2 and q + 2 on the number line:

This number line shows that p − 2 and q + 2 are also consecutive even integers. Hence, p can be larger than q.

Next, we check whether p can be less than q. Place p and q on a number line:

Then, place p − 2 and q + 2 on the number line:

On this number line, p − 2 and q + 2 are not consecutive even integers. Hence, p cannot be less than q. The answer is (A).

','','','','','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','0','0','12','0');

Hence, the product xy is even and Statement I is true. As to Statement II, suppose z is odd, then x must be odd as well. Now, the difference of two odd numbers is an even number. insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('6974','678','If − x − 2 = −|−(6 − |, then x =','null','','null','null','null','null','47bf4f5bfeae7d3dd2885d201e66ecae5dcef4beAgxXBwpWUVVSBl0HAQEDCgBTAld9VRITGw8EAldYRARdXwsbBEpXXF8YEBIBAlADXRYLRQgZRBsBUgYAD08UFgAAAQJeS1IYHhENVApXCRFTEUodGUEKVAgWBQBYBxoEFgBZDBQOEgBcBQMBAFVSXVtTUFZcBldXVVpT','null','null','null','   −5 ','   −2 ','   0 ','   2 ','   5 ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','D','null','null','null','null','Working from the innermost parentheses out, we get

− x − 2 = −|−(6 − 2)|

− x − 2 = −|−4|

−x − 2 = −(+4)

−x − 2 = −4

−x = −2

x = 2

The answer is (D).

','null','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','null','null','17','null');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('6975','678','If the sum of two prime numbers x and y is odd, then the product of x and ... ...','null','','null','null','null','null','abcee96f8985b756aec2b919e5b200881306454eAQFWD1UAAFAMVlIEVVwCVAwBVQR7URkXXgAXFRdURAsHEUJCVxZGFAtYUhkIFl5WXRRFRl0BDlhNC0wEXwkZAlgBF1oHVFodXR5TWAYWXxVCWlNdSkNHXF0IFhIJAUMWR1gHFFFDGQxQRQsDDwccWE5UWwsYV1gCQglSVFgaDxtdCwhGDBEQEhVVBkFWXk8KRQxVCgcZBh1BUw8EAVMDBFAFBwFeUgAEDlIDUgQ','null','null','null','   2 ','   3 ','   4 ','   5 ','   8 ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','A','null','We are told that the sum of the prime numbers x and y is odd. For a sum of two numbers to be odd, one number must be odd and another even. There is only one even prime number—2; all others are odd. Hence, either x or y must be 2. Thus, the product of x and y is a multiple of 2 and therefore is divisible by 2. The answer is (A).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('6976','678',' ... ...','null','','null','null','null','null','','null','null','null','   x is divisible by 4 ','   y is an odd number ','   y is an even integer ','   x is an even number ','   x is an irreducible fraction ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','D','null','null','null','null','Solution: . Multiplying both sides of this equation by (x − y) yields

x + y = 3(x − y)

x + y = 3x − 3y 

−2x = −4y        

x = 2y              

Since we have expressed x as 2 times an integer, it is even. The answer is (D).

','null','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','null','null','19','null');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('6977','678','A two-digit even number is such that reversing its digits creates an odd ... ...','null','','null','null','null','null','','null','null','null','   1 ','   3 ','   5 ','   7 ','   9 ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','E','null','null','null','null','null','Let the original number be represented by xy. (Note: here xy does not denote multiplication, but merely the position of the digits: x first, then y.). Reversing the digits of xy gives yx. We are told that yx > xy. This implies that y > x. (For example, 73 > 69 because 7 > 6.) If x = 9, then the condition y > x cannot be satisfied. Hence, x cannot equal 9. The answer is (E).

Method II:

Let the original number be represented by xy. In expanded form, xy can be written as 10x + y. For example, 53 = 5(10) + 3. Similarly, yx = 10y + x. Since yx > xy, we get 10y + x > 10x + y. Subtracting x and y from both sides of this equation yields 9y > 9x. Dividing this equation by 9 yields y > x. Now, if x = 9, then the inequality y > x cannot be satisfied. The answer is (E).

','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','null','null','20','null');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('6978','678','Let a, b, and c be three integers, and let a be a perfect square. If a/b ... ...','null','','null','null','null','null','','null','null','null','   c must be an even number ','   c must be an odd number ','   c must be a perfect square ','   c must not be a perfect square ','   c must be a prime number ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','C','null','null','null','Cross multiplying the equation a/b = b/c yields

 

ac = b2

Dividing by a yields

c = b2/a

We are given that a is a perfect square. Hence, a = k2, for some number k. Replacing a in the bottom equation with k2, we get c = b2/k2 = (b/k)2. Since we have written c as the square of a number, it is a perfect square. The answer is (C).

','null','null','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','null','null','21','null');

','   S is always even. ','   S must be a prime number. ','   S must not be a prime number. ','   S must be a perfect square. ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','D','null','null','null','null','Observe that n and (n + 1) are consecutive integers. Hence, we can represent the number as 12x + 7. Now, 7 can be written as 6 + 1. Plugging this into the expression yields

 

12x + (6 + 1) =

 

 

 

(12x + 6) + 1 =

by regrouping

 

 

6(2x + 1) + 1

by factoring 6 out of the first two terms

This shows that the remainder is 1 when the expression 12x + 7 is divided by 6. The answer is (A).

Method II (Substitution):

Choose the number 19, which gives a remainder of 7 when divided by 12. Now, divide 19 by 6:

Then n3 = 13 = 1, which is odd. Now, we plug this value for n into each of the answerchoices to see which ones are even. Thus, 2n2 + 1 becomes 2(1)2 + 1 = 3 = 3, which is not even. So eliminate (A). Next, n4 = 14 = 1 is not even—eliminate (B). Next, n2 + 1 = 12 + 1 = 2 is even, so the answer is possibly (C). Next, n(n + 2) = 1(1 + 2) = 3 is not even—eliminate (D). Finally, n = 1, which is not even—eliminate (E). Hence, by the process of elimination, the answer is (C).

','null','null','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','null','null','29','null');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('6988','678','If the sum of three consecutive integers is odd, then the first and the ... ...','null','','null','null','null','null','53853f471b046ecca56e4449d5e2755714083ae7UFcFDwNRVVANVlwADQsDAFwPVV16VhEXUVIUQRQJFQxSEBJeFgFQQ1AMCkpVURNAUBBdQlBdFlcCXBFLE1lCQ1ZTUB5BEF0GWhASXgFEUwpBEBAZUVwCFE0OXUJVUhFGRVANTFZXVBFKF1lHEhAVAVEQUgJQXVFWVlFTDAUFVwAJXgsDXAQ','null','null','null','   odd, even ','   odd, odd ','   even, odd ','   even, even ','   none of the above ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','D','null','null','null','null','Let the three consecutive integers be x, x + 1, and x + 2. The sum of these integers is 3x + 3. According to the question, this sum is odd. Hence 3x + 3 is odd. Recall that if the sum of two integers is odd, then one of the integers is odd and the other one is even. Since 3 in the expression 3x + 3 is odd, 3x must be even. Now, recall that the product of two numbers is odd only when one of the numbers is odd and the other is even. So x must be even. If x is an even number, then x + 2 is also even. Thus, the first and the last integers must both be even. The answer is (D).

','null','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','null','null','31','null');

','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','B','null','null','Let the three consecutive positive integers be n, n + 1, and n + 2. The sum of these three positive integers is

Ship ... ...','null','','null','null','null','null','','null','null','null','   1 ','   2 ','   3 ','   4 ','   5 ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','D','null','null','null','null','Let d be the distance ship Y is from the point of collision. Then the distance ship X is from the point of collision is d – 1. The following diagram depicts the situation:

Applying the Pythagorean Theorem to the diagram yields

d2 + (d – 1)2 = 52

d2 + d2 – 2d + 1 = 25

2d2 – 2d – 24 = 0

d2 – d – 12 = 0

(d – 4)(d + 3) = 0

d = 4 or d = –3

Since d denotes distance, we reject d = –3. Hence, d = 4 and the answer is (D).

Hence, its base angles are equal: y = z. Since the angle sum of a triangle is 180°, we get x + y + z = 180. Replacing z with y and x with 30 in this equation and then simplifying yields

What is the value of y?','null','9b9cffad9d13c08db8a196a0ac5cdcfb4d767f92UlFUA1BTUFMNVF1WBltUCwwADwNeUAsDFBZDGglRXBMUUkdNW1MEXRwEWVwEXllaUABdWFdBFUpHVQREBUsDO1oKQQI6XQxQBVJGFlQAVAAESAUETVoTUBtEWFhGXhdwWFdeA0AHWktdCFBdXAIAAQNUAFpWUwNTBQECA1RWWgU','','','','null','6b63329f42c843934e162d071303832acecaacc6VQYDB1dRC1QEVQJTAQ9ZUwtSBVR6VkTaoYIOGgxcUApZUwsJZjRkXRlXDw9EQVBfRwtKEQlSVV9LWBxUXgZEExcMV1hbSwsbAFtYFwtFB1QGHEJmDFNMEFkWRkVdUhgXUwhGVBNXAhgLVV8LHA0YUQgIWRcEAQZWBwFSAlwBClFTAAVQVFRbVw','','','','   60','   55','   50','   45','   40  ','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','e','','','','','','Again since the base angles of an isosceles triangle are equal, the diagram becomes

Since x and z form a straight angle, x + z = 180. Hence, we have the system:

x + z = 180

y + z = 150

Subtracting these equations yields x – y = 30. Since there are two variables and only one equation, we need another equation in order to determine y. However, since the angle sum of a triangle is 180°, x + x + y = 180, or 2x + y = 180. This yields the system:

x – y = 30

2x + y = 180

Adding the equations gives 3x = 210. Hence, x = 70. Plugging this value for x back into either equation gives y = 40. The answer is (E).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7056','682','Column A Column B   Perimeter of a square whose area is a2 Perimeter ... ...','null','9347139ebfe3d89c189f505f7b2b5d0c5728680aUQdRAwJVUFMNUQJaAwtVBAFVDlAXVlNRBFVQBlsGVgIFUFYCXAIICVM','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','','null','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','','','Column A: Remember that the area of a square is equal to the length of its side squared. Since the area of the square is a2, the side of the square is a. Hence, the perimeter of the square is P = a + a + a + a = 4a.

Column B: Let b represent the length of the equal sides of the right-angled isosceles triangle, and let c represent the length of the hypotenuse:

Since the hypotenuse of a right triangle is opposite the right angle, the sides labeled b are the base and height of the triangle. The area of the triangle is base × height = bb = b2. We are given that the area of the triangle is a2. Hence, b2 = a2. Solving this equation for b yields b = a. To calculate the hypotenuse, c, of the triangle we apply the Pythagorean Theorem:

c2 = b2 + b2

c2 = 2b2

c =

c =

c =

c = 2a

The perimeter of the triangle is P = b + b + c = 2b + c = 2a + 2a = a(2 + 2). Recall that ≈ 1.4. Hence, a(2 + 2) ≈ a(2.8 + 2) = 4.48a > 4a. Hence, the perimeter of the triangle is greater than the perimeter of the square, and the answer is (B).

','','','','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','0','0','48','0');

From the standard formula for the perimeter of a rectangle, we get

P = 2L + 2W = 2(6m) + 2(4m) = 20m

Now, the formula for the perimeter of a square is 4x, where x represents the length of a side of the square. Since we are given that the perimeter of the square is equal to that of the rectangle, we write

x = 20m/4 = 5m

The answer is (C).

Recall that in a right triangle the hypotenuse is the longest side. Hence, AC > x. Now, consider triangle ABC. Observe that ∠B is opposite side AC and ∠BAC is opposite side BC. Since, BC = x and AC > x, we can write that AC > BC. Recall that in a triangle, the angle opposite the greater side is the greater angle. Hence, ∠B > ∠BAC. Since ∠B = 30°, ∠BAC must be less than 30°. From the exterior angle theorem, θ = ∠B + ∠BAC = 30 + ∠BAC. We have already derived that ∠BAC < 30°. Adding 30 to both sides of this inequality yields 30 + ∠BAC < 60. Replacing 30 + ∠BAC with θ, we get θ < 60. Hence, Column B is larger, and the answer is (B).

Hence, ∠AOC = ∠BOD = x. Since a straight angle has 180°, we get the following equation:

z + x + y = 180

The area of the rectangle, being the product of two adjacent sides of the rectangle, is x(x + 6) = 3(9) = 27. The answer is (D).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7067','682','The value of x + y + z =','null','','null','null','null','null','03ca7283ee622df10775b9136bfc11fa78387b5aUwdVBFFTVQcFBFYGAF5XUQlSAQZgWVBDRVUPTAdFXVcQDgdVDh1eGlVeChJJEFoGXApLWBsDW10QTxdfUVwLGQ8bBlRcRQ8RUgtTCwYHBFYBAlJTVQhVWwZWBwU','null','null','null','   120° ','   160° ','   180° ','   270° ','   360° ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','C','null','null','null','Since angles A, B, and C are the interior angles of the triangle, their angle sum is 180°. insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7068','682','In the figure, what is the area of Triangle ABC?','null','d50540eafdbada80e75b618e85d8d185711ec377AVZQVAcCCgUDBVFUAgEAAV1UBwFYXV1RGEZCQFVVDURDVEFNWgFVXk8DXQtTDwMMXlFRWlMbQUAWAQxGA0ZVaVZaQFhmWV0HUlRAFlVSBQNbTwFWGgtJBhUVVFpCBEN6CQNWAUYKDBlRWFEHDwEIAw0EVwFXUwwHVVMAB1dSDlY','','','','null','9e4f9e93e2c0b76d5858284ecdd1a950fdf9feb8UlFZAFBWVVdQA1FQAQFQA10OB1N4VkRDClZDUA0FFkEBHxNOWwMXEFgWGEILUEZSFlZUElpfEWUWUVBYVlQBF15WDgglICAPS1ZeBwxCUQgFAFtSBwQHClEDU1ZTAFdUBgA','','','','   25','   50','   100/','   100','   100','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','','','In a triangle, the sum of the interior angles is 180 degrees. Applying this to Triangle ADC yields


∠DAC + ∠C + ∠CDA = 180

45 + ∠C + 90 = 180,
since ∠DAC = 45° and ∠CDA = 90°


∠C = 180 – 90 – 45 = 45

In Triangle ABC, AB = AC. Recall that angles opposite equal sides of a triangle are equal. Hence, ∠B = ∠C. We have already derived that ∠C = 45°. Hence, ∠B = ∠C = 45°. Again, the sum of the interior angles of a triangle is 180 degrees. Applying this to Triangle ABC yields

∠A + ∠B + ∠C = 180

∠A + 45 + 45 = 180

∠A = 90

This implies that Triangle ABC is a right triangle with right angle at A. Hence, the area of the triangle is

The answer is (B).

','','','','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','0','0','60','0');

Column B   4x z','null','22248120a0ada49fd6115ec06d2a6042bb18f0c7UAUDVAAABFZSUVIDBFtRUAEGAFAMRxNTDVMXQw0RRVQBCABGDV8NDFQRAQ5SEEQPRANaDlMIEkJLQlUIElBBVT5cC0ZRbFhYAgMAFxxSVlEeAVNMWRNQEEYAWhUNQXkPWVdTFw4LHEBfBwFTAAVVBwJSVVABAQZQC1dSAQQ','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','','null','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','','In a triangle, the sum of any two sides is greater than the third side. The formula for the area of a triangle is A = (1/2)(base)(height). Hence, the area of Triangle ABC = (1/2)(BC)(AF) = (1/2)(2 + 1)(AF) = (3/2)(AF) = 30 (the area of Triangle ABC is given to be 30). From this, we make two observations:

1)  The center of the circle is on the x-axis.

2)  The diameter of the circle is 8.

Since the center of the circle is on the x-axis, the points (2, 0) and (x, 0) must be diametrically opposite points of the circle. That is, they are end points of a diameter of the circle. Hence, the distance between the two points, x – 2, must equal the length of the diameter. Hence, x – 2 = 8. Adding 2 to both sides of this equation, we get x = 10. The answer is (D).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7083','684','','null','377bf91a3dac94982c8d2e0f623b908729261c05VA1UVwpVVVYGBlxQUVpZBFgBBVEPXFpTGQJVUBZLXhJSXg4BXhQSGERNTA1cC0REV0RMWwYDVBsAW1pTXQ9aXV0FVVRHGBBCUw9DBUdTbVZYT1Q+UFsHVVdFF1RVUwwOTAcBGQMHGV5JBhsRBFQXDRJ7DANSUxAGCxZcDF4IVFcCUA4AVgABBlkAAQ0BAwZXCVQ','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','Both columns are equal','There is not enough information','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','','Whatever the coordinates of P are, the line OP is the hypotenuse of a right triangle with sides being the absolute value of the x and y coordinates. Hence, OP is greater than the y-coordinate of point P. The answer is (A).

This problem brings up the issue of how much you can assume when viewing a diagram. We are told that P is a point in the coordinate system and that it appears in the second quadrant. Could P be on one of the axes or in another quadrant? No. Although P could be anywhere in Quadrant II (not necessarily where it is displayed), P could not be on the y-axis because the “position of points, angles, regions, etc. can be assumed to be in the order shown.” If P were on the y-axis, then it would not be to the left of the y-axis, as it is in the diagram. That is, the order would be different. [By the way, if P could also be on the axes, the answer would be (D). Why?]

','','','','','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','0','0','2','0');

0 = pb + a

Subtracting a from both sides yields

–a = pb

Dividing both sides by b yields

–a/b = p

Hence, Column A equals Column B, and the answer is (C).

 

','','','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','0','0','3','0');

A car travels from A ... ...','null','','null','null','null','null','','null','null','null','   48 ','   50 ','   52 ','   56 ','   58 ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','A','null','We can eliminate 50 (the mere average of 40 and 60) since that would be too elementary. Now, the average must be closer to 40 than to 60 because the car travels for a longer time at 40 mph. But 48 is the only number given that is closer to 40 than to 60. The answer is (A).

It’s instructive to also calculate the answer. Average Speed . Now, a car traveling at 40 mph will cover 120 miles in 3 hours. And a car traveling at 60 mph will cover the same 120 miles in 2 hours. So the total traveling time is 5 hours. Hence, for the round trip, the average speed is = 48.

','null','null','null','null','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','null','null','null','null');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7102','685','If w is 10 percent less than x, and y is 30 percent less than z, then wy ... ...','null','','null','null','null','null','','null','null','null','   10% ','   20% ','   37% ','   40% ','   100% ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','C','null','null','null','We eliminate (A) since it repeats the number 10 from the problem. We can also eliminate choices (B), (D), and (E) since they are derivable from elementary operations:

20 = 30 – 10

40 = 30 + 10

100 = 10 · 10

This leaves choice (C) as the answer.

Let’s also solve this problem directly. The clause

 

    w is 10 percent less than x

translates into

    w = x – .10x

Simplifying yields

1) w = .9x

Next, the clause

    y is 30 percent less than z

translates into

    y = z – .30z

Simplifying yields

2) y = .7z

Multiplying 1) and 2) gives

    wy = (.9x)(.7z) = .63xz = xz – .37xz

Hence, wy is 37 percent less than xz. The answer is (C).

','null','null','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','null','null','null','null');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7103','685','In the game of chess, the Knight can make any of the moves displayed in ... ...','null','','null','null','null','null','','null','null','null','   8 ','   24 ','   38 ','   48 ','   56 ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','D','null','null','null','null','Since we are looking for the greatest number of spaces from which not all 8 moves are possible, we can eliminate the greatest number, 56. Now, clearly not all 8 moves are possible from the outer squares, and there are 28 outer squares—not 32. Also, not all 8 moves are possible from the next to outer squares, and there are 20 of them—not 24. All 8 moves are possible from the remaining squares. Hence, the answer is 28 + 20 = 48. The answer is (D). Notice that 56, (32 + 24), is given as an answer-choice to catch those who don’t add carefully.

','null','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','null','null','null','null');

Further, we can eliminate (A), 5, because answer-choices (B) and (D) form a more complicated set. At this stage we cannot apply any more elimination rules; so if we could not solve the problem, we would guess either (B) or (D).

Let’s solve the problem directly. The drawing below shows the position of the circles so that the paper width is a minimum.

Now, take three of the circles in isolation, and connect the centers of these circles to form a triangle:

Since the triangle connects the centers of circles of diameter 4, the triangle is equilateral with sides of length 4.

Drawing an altitude gives

Applying the Pythagorean Theorem to either right triangle gives

h2 + 22 = 42

Squaring yields

h2 + 4 = 16

Subtracting 4 from both sides of this equation yields

h2 = 12

Taking the square root of both sides yields

h = =

Removing the perfect square 4 from the radical yields

h =2

Summarizing gives

Adding to the height, h =2, the distance above the triangle and the distance below the triangle to the edges of the paper strip gives

width = (2 + 2) + 2= 4 + 2

The answer is (B).

','null','null','null','2011-11-18 22:06:56','0','null','null','null','null');

If x2 + Kx + 5 factors into (x + (x + C), the ... ...','null','','null','null','null','null','','null','null','null','   0 ','   5 ','   6 ','   8 ','   not enough information

','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','C','null','null','null','Since the number 5 is merely repeated from the problem, we eliminate (B). Further, since this is a hard problem, we eliminate (E), “not enough information.”

Now, since 5 is prime, its only factors are 1 and 5. So the constant C in the expression (x + 1)(x + C) must be 5:

(x + 1)(x + 5)

Multiplying out this expression yields

(x + 1)(x + 5) = x2 + 5x + x + 5

Combining like terms yields

(x + 1)(x + 5) = x2 + 6x + 5

Hence, K = 6, and the answer is (C).

x2 = 2x

Subtracting 2x from both sides yields

x2 – 2x = 0

Factoring yields

x(x – 2) = 0

Setting each factor to zero yields

x = 0 and x – 2 = 0

Solving yields

x = 0 and x = 2

Setting up a number line and choosing test points (the circled numbers on the number line below) yields

Now, if x = –1, the inequality x2 < 2x becomes (–1)2 < 2(–1), or 1 < –2. This is false. Hence, Interval I is not a solution. If x = 1, the inequality x2 < 2x becomes 12 < 2(1), or 1 < 2. This is true. Hence, Interval II is a solution. If x = 3, the inequality x2 < 2x becomes 32 < 2(3), or 9 < 6. This is false. Hence, Interval III is not a solution. Thus, only Interval II is a solution:

The answer is (B).

','','','','2011-11-18 22:08:16','0','0','0','7','0');

What ... ...','null','','null','null','null','null','','null','null','null','   –18 ','   –17 ','   –14 ','   –11 ','   –9 ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','B','null','null','First, bring the negative symbol in the expression to the top:

To make this expression as small as possible, we need to make both the y – x and z as small as possible. To make y – x as small as possible, let y = 1 and x = 19. Then y – x = 1 – 19 = –18. With these choices for y and x, the smallest remaining value for z is 2. This gives

In this case, we made the numerator as small as possible. Now, let’s make the denominator as small as possible. To that end, chose z = 1 and y = 2 and x = 19. This gives

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7125','686','Column A m = |n|, m ≠ n, and m ≠ 0 Column B   mn   ... ...','null','57b04db3ac647f4d18bb696bc534be2650367018UVADAwFSBlFVVVdbBA9VBg8GUlQMBg5bWQ0eUwlfQgtDSgsBXw5YCR0BDwtOHRUJBAgNVAwYUVkIEIa4kENfAFkPXwpLBA8ITxZWClYQClBfWg8JHVRYC0GHupkQBwINAFIHBANXAQAGBwQGV1dVBlIO','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','','','Since m = |n|, we know m is equal to either n or –n. We are given that m ≠ n. The only possibility remaining is m = –n. This reduces the expressions in the columns as follows:

Column A: mn = (–n)n = –n2 < 0.

Column B: m + n = (–n) + n = 0.

Hence, Column B is larger, and the answer is (B).

','','','','2011-11-18 22:08:16','0','0','0','18','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7126','686','Column A x + y ≥ 5 and x < 5 Column B   y   0','null','47bb31db7f43cffce2535d4ec658f43a71aeaf30VgRYVwMGAlRQCVZXUV4FAAoCUwcLXV9aHUFJEk0JGFNeW0XRuZISUxVRVwUQWVRdWkEOGgALWhIPFFBXUwxXB1NUWlQABlYBAgQAUlYEAg','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','','Since x is less than 5, we can observe that for x + y to be greater than or equal to 5, y must be greater than 0. Hence, the answer is (A). This can be shown explicitly as follows:

Subtracting x from both sides of the inequality x ± y > 5 yields

y ≥ 5 – x

Now, let’s build the term 5 – x out of the inequality x < 5. To this end, subtract x from both sides of the inequality. This yields

0 < 5 – x

Rewriting this inequality with 5 – x on the left and 0 on the right yields

5 – x > 0

Note that the inequality symbol still points toward 0, so the statement of the inequality has not changed. In general, if x < y, then y > x. In other words, the inequality symbol always points toward the smaller number, regardless of whether the symbol points left or right.

Substituting this result into the inequality y ≥ 5 – x yields

y ≥ 5 – x > 0

By the transitive property of inequalities, y > 0. Hence, Column A is greater, and the answer is (A).

','','','','','2011-11-18 22:08:16','0','0','0','19','0');

The product of two numbers is positive only if both numbers are positive or both numbers are negative. Since rt = 1 and r > t, there are two possibilities:

   Case I (both negative): –1 < r < 0 and t < –1

Case II (both positive): 0 < t < 1 and r > 1

The second case violates the condition r < 1. Hence, Case I is true, and the answer is (B).

Since y is between 0 and 1, 1/y is greater than y. (For example, if y = 1/2, then .) Expressing this with an inequality yields

1/y > y

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7129','686','Column A 3x + y < 6 and x = 2 Column B   x + y   x – ... ...','null','5532f7e1fb93e617a7c665a2f6bd70ddba007796BQYADlBbClAHUQBXBFxVCwlUVwRVDlBVXRxeTARZCEYSGA8AXFpACElXDAZDBBkCEwAKURBYUVQOGl1OA18LGF5EUFVUVQQAD1pXUgEAXVYHAlEPVAEP','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','undefined','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','','','We are given that x = 2. Replacing x with 2 in the inequality 3x + y < 6 yields

3(2) + y < 6

y < 0            by subtracting 6 from both sides

Hence, the answer is (B).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7132','686','Column A |m| = |n|, and m > n Column B   m + n   m – ... ...','null','b891c44925d45cfffc7b8cc88ce97f05e6a53e10BQMFU1UFUgFWUVVVUVoAA1pSBV0aWlVeCgwFGlJeDEkVDhNFCVEOCAgLSwALWB1JQgBfU0VeBFxdCQ8XAwsOEwpBBVBaDVwJGlZeBw1XAA5eVAFcUQBRUAdXUAJWB1AB','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','undefined','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','','','We are given that m > n. This implies that m ≠ n. But it is also given that |m| = |n|. This implies that m is equal to n in magnitude but not in sign. We conclude that m and n have different signs. Since m is greater than n, and since positive numbers are greater than negative numbers, we conclude that m is positive and n is negative. Hence, m = –n. Substituting this information into both columns yields

Column A: m + n = (–n) + n = 0

Column B: m – n = m – (–m) = m + m = 2m

Since m is positive, 2m is positive. Hence, Column B is greater than Column A. The answer is (B).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7136','686','Column A x > y > 0 Column B    ','null','042699d672a10a534347f781cc134b1327ae9f9cUVBQBwcFBlMDU1QHA10FUwsBDlEOUglYGUZYFU8NTgAJCRVaEVVWBgpVUlIFVQFVBlACUlYAXQcLVA','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','undefined','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','','Since it is given that x > y > 0, we know that x > y and that both x and y are positive. Now, let’s construct the expressions in columns A and B from the inequality x > y.

Subtracting y from both sides of the inequality x > y yields x – y > 0. Dividing both sides of this inequality by x, which is positive, yields > 0. This shows that the term in Column A is positive.

Turning to Column B, subtract x from both sides of the inequality x > y. This gives 0 > y – x. Rearranging this inequality with the smaller number on the left yields y – x < 0. Dividing both sides of this inequality by y, which is positive, yields < 0. This shows that the term in Column B is negative.

Since a positive number is greater than a negative number, Column A is greater than Column B. The answer is (A).

','','','','','2011-11-18 22:08:16','0','0','0','29','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7137','686','Column A x ≠ 0 Column B    ','null','eef40db3128353904cbd1237e740858d31b69385AQVZVAcBBQFSBwUEAFtTVgwFVQcKXF1dSg0ZUQ4PRtOwkxFUUgRQAAcGDFIMVw4BVQYDUA1QClE','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','undefined','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','','','','There are two possible cases:

Case I: When x is positive, |x| = x, and |1/x| = 1/x. Also, |x + 1/x| = x + 1/x. Hence, |x| + |1/x| = |x + 1/x|.

Case II: When x is negative, |x| = –x, and |1/x| = –1/x. Also, |x + 1/x| = –(x + 1/x) = –x – 1/x. Hence, |x + 1/x| = –x – 1/x = |x| + |1/x|.

Since, in both the cases |x| + |1/x| = |x + 1/x|, Column A equals Column B. The answer is (C).

','','','2011-11-18 22:08:16','0','0','0','30','0');

2y + x < n

Multiplying both sides of the bottom inequality by –1 and flipping the direction of the inequality yields

(2x + y) + (–2y – x) > m – n

(2x – x) + (–2y + y) > m – n

x – y > m – n

The answer is (B).

Then x equals','null','3040ca2b65d944d9b555294a5428ae2c17b17471VABSUlAFV1IGAF0ADFpTUFpVBlURA1sDB1YAA1tZXQNQV1NWCVMABAY','','','','null','','','','','1','2','3','6','7','null','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','e','Clearing fractions in the equation y – 2 = gives

Distributing the 2 gives

x = y – 2 = 9 – 2 = 7

Hence, enter 7 in the box.

x = 3y

3y = 4z

x = 4z

Multiplying both sides of the equation x = 3y by 6 gives 6x = 18y. Hence, Choice (A) is wrong. Next, 3y + 20z = 3y + 5(4z). Substituting x for 3y and for 4z in this equation gives 3y + 20z = 3y + 5(4z) = x + 5x = 6x. Hence, Choice (B) is true. Finally, (42y + 16z)/3 = (14 · 3y + 4 · 4z)/3 = (14 · x + 4 · x)/3 = 18x/3 = 6x. Choice (C) is true. Thus, the answer consists of choices (B), and (C).

','','','','','','2011-11-18 22:08:17','0','0','0','6','0');

.04(p + q) = 8

Dividing both sides of this equation by .04 yields

p + q = 8/.04 = 200

Subtracting p from both sides yields

q = 200 – p

This expression will be greatest when p is as small as possible. This is when p = 1:

q = 200 – 1 = 199

The answer is (D).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7166','688','If x5 = 4 and x4 = , then what is the value of x in terms of y?','null','a3ac6fa6e352f1a15f5e0ce10470ebf2ad0afe62UVdQVAcGUAUDU10AV1sECwtQBVcUCVsAUAgHAlNQVARRBAVSWAJVUwA','','','','null','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','','','The expression x5 = 4 can be rewritten as

x · x4 = 4

Replacing x4 in this expression with 7/y yields

Multiplying both sides of this equation by y gives

x · 7 = 4 · y

Dividing both sides of this equation by 7 yields

Hence, the answer is (B).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7167','688','If s + S ≠ 0 and , then what is s in terms of S?','null','','null','null','null','null','','null','null','null','   s = S + 3 ','   s = 4S ','   s = S/12 ','   s = –7S ','   s = 4S – 6 ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','D','null','null','null','null','First, clear fractions by multiplying both sides by 12(s + S):

4(s + S) = 3(s – S)

Next, distribute the 3 and the 4:

4s + 4S = 3s – 3S

Finally, subtract 3s and 4S from both sides:

s = –7S

The answer is (D).

 

','null','2011-11-18 22:08:17','0','null','null','11','null');

Dividing by 3 yields

y = 3 – 2x

Adding 2x yields

2x + y = 3

Notice that this is the top equation in the system. Hence, the system is only one equation in two different forms. Thus, there are an infinite number of solutions. For example, the pair x = 2, y = –1 is a solution as is the pair x = 0, y = 3. The answer is (E).

Thus, (–8)2n is equal to

82n

This in turn can be written as

Multiplying the exponents gives

26n

Plugging this into the original equation gives

The answer is (B).

x2 + y2 = x2 – 2xy + y2

Subtracting x2 and y2 from both sides of the equation yields

0 = –2xy

Dividing by –2 gives

Hence, x = 0 or y = 0 or both. If x = 0, then x2 = 0 and = In this case the columns are equal.

Next, if y = 0, then = Now, suppose x = 1, then x2 = 12 = 1. In this case, the columns are not equal. This is a double case, and the answer is (D).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7178','688','Column A 4y = 2x – 6 Column B     x = 2y + 3     ... ...','null','46d23c2138d48fd18c9f93fcd7f26524b8f34c4cUgNZBARaBlxXBFMGAl0DB1pXD1dVDVxbCEEMS1VVCxAPEQEJA11fHg0YXV8JGde48BQBWFQXXBVfBFQMGQ0WU1sGEFkQCglVXw9KCUlVDFgRHBgBDgpTWwcDUVYAUFABAVlfAVVSDVU','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','','','','','Start with the top equation, 4y = 2x – 6.

Adding 6 to both sides yields

4y + 6 = 2x

Rearranging yields

2x = 4y + 6

Dividing both sides by 2 yields

x = 2y + 3

Note that this equation is same as the bottom equation. Hence, we actually have only one equation but two unknowns, x and y. Remember that we need two distinct equations to solve for two variables. Hence, there is not enough information to determine the values of x and y. The answer is (D).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7179','688','If x + 3y = 5 and 3x + y = 7, then x + y =','null','','null','null','null','null','dd42c67395e727810abcafbe5ee3e2b5c1064b08UQZUB1FTBlEAVQEEUg4EAFwCDlV/BUZfV1QMSQUeAVkLQxNDUVkEWQxLCR4HXQsVCUVQRgdYARJWCF1dCBtGSBJADh5cXFoUCEMPT0IRCVFcEglUDw5NFR9FHFpJUwgMRQkYUVABA1ZXXAFUC1NRVwRTDlcAVVk','null','null','null','   1 ','   2 ','   3 ','   4 ','   5 ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','C','null','null','null','Forming a system from the two given equations yields

x + 3y = 5

3x + y = 7

Adding the two equations yields

4x + 4y = 12

 

4(x + y) = 12

by factoring out 4

x + y = 12/4 = 3

by dividing by 4

The answer is (C).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7180','688','Column A x + 3y = 2 and 3x + y = 14 Column B   x + y   x – ... ...','null','372f37103db5a241d01f558575251a1b81241e8aVQJYUFZbCwFWUVYBUgEABA5VUgMJUgkLHQ9KBlhcFkgRAQlVXQYcDxlTVFhFBRhXQgBcB0YKXVNaXRxaGlIJC0UYRV9QDwgaDR1QXQ4YWBMHAgxTXQ0PUFBUAwJXW1kHBVdVAw1W','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','','','Writing the system of two given equations vertically yields

x + 3y = 2

3x + y = 14

First, adding the two equations yields

4x + 4y = 16

4(x + y) = 16

by factoring out 4

x + y = 16/4 = 4

by dividing by 4

Now, consider the system of the two given equations again

3x + y = 14

x + 3y = 2

Second, subtracting the two equations yields

2x – 2y = 12

 

2(x – y) = 12

by factoring out 2

x – y = 12/2 = 6

by dividing by 2

The answer is (B).

','','','','2011-11-18 22:08:17','0','0','0','24','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7181','688','If 7x – y = 23 and 7y – x = 31, then x + y =','null','','null','null','null','null','72e20864bc41e101fa2045d60d1f39111e2e4d62UVIHAgFSUQFQBVJbUABVBgABBVR7BxQFWQAICkAWEhUKA1BXCBkfCh0DCwoSDEJXVxVXVwAYAwhcWg1IEkcXCldUVA8YTggZV1xfRg4ZVQceRhJcV19CWQFYCEFEExRNBRhWXAxBCRJRUAECCFIFUAEIUFcCXFRTBgJQBg','null','null','null','   4 ','   6 ','   7 ','   8 ','   9 ','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','null','E','null','null','null','null','null','Aligning the system of equations vertically yields

7x – y = 23

7y – x = 31

Adding the system of equations yields

(7x – y) + (7y – x) = 23 + 31

 

(7x – x) + (7y – y) = 54

by collecting like terms

6x + 6y = 54

by adding like terms

6(x + y) = 54

by factoring out 6

x + y = 9

by dividing both sides by 6

The answer is (E).

','2011-11-18 22:08:17','0','null','null','25','null');

x + y = 4a/5

y + z = 7a/5

z + x = 9a/5

Adding the three equations yields

(x + y) + (y + z) + (z + x) = 4a/5 + 7a/5 + 9a/5

by adding like terms

by dividing both sides by 2

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7183','688','Column A x + y + z = 10 and Column B     x – y – ... ...','null','8a414b6fe1e22ddc9bc04d9510fc0716423fe435UVZSBgBWUgIGUwUGBgtSBAAOVVAEXVwNThMdQ0kXSRMfWUlQWA8SXhJTAxBSWwVGEkNdAV8NSxbbuPAVQRjTs6UTTF8fUg8NRVhGDQFVC1YDUlVTAwJQUAZRUgJXBwAD','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','','Writing the system of two equations vertically yields

x + y + z = 10

x – y – z = 8

Adding the two equations yields

2x = 18

x = 9

Hence, Column A has a value of 9. Replacing x with 9 in the equation x + y + z = 10 yields

9 + y + z = 10

 

y + z = 1

by subtracting 9 from both sides

Hence, Column B has a value of 1. The answer is (A).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7184','688','Column A x + y + z = 10 and Column B     x – y – ... ...','null','7e5b630833f45bf9bb49ab3ce77745a35525d474BwFYAVUAUFQFBlNUBwxUVF8BBAYJAVlfGRkSFUkSHhcfCktRVQ8UCUQECRcHDQcQERYXClZZCx5G1bLwFR0Ug+GqGU8MHVBaWxZZFABQVgcHUA4AUVdWUQIDAgQGUAFRUg','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','','','','','Unless a system of equations has at least as many equations as variables, it is unlikely to have a unique solution. Since we have three variables—x, y, and z—and only two equations, there probably is not a unique solution to this system. If x = 9, y = 0, and z = 1, then both equations are satisfied and Column A is larger. However, if x = 9, y = 10, and z = –9, then both equations are satisfied and Column B is larger. This is a double case and therefore the answer is (D).

 

Note, students often mistakenly add 2x to both sides of this equation because of the minus symbol between 2x and 10. But 2x is positive, so we subtract it. This can be seen more clearly by rewriting the right side of the equation as –10 + 2x.

5(y2 – 4y + 3) = 0

Dividing both sides of this equation by 5 yields

y2 – 4y + 3 = 0

Since 3 + 1 = 4, the trinomial factors into

(y – 3)(y – l) = 0

Setting each factor equal to zero yields

y – 3 = 0 and y – 1 = 0

Solving these equations yields y = 3 and y = 1. Now, the difference of 3 and 1 is 2 and twice 2 is 4. Further, the difference of 1 and 3 is –2 and twice –2 is –4. Hence, in both cases, Column B is larger. The answer is (B).

','','','','2011-11-18 22:08:17','0','0','0','5','0');

x2 – y2 =

 

(x + y)(x – y) =

since x2 – y2 is a difference of squares

50

 

The answer is (A). This problem can also be solved by adding the two equations. However, that approach will lead to long, messy fractions. insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7231','692','Column A   Column B   x(x – y) – z(x – y)   ... ...','null','d9a75302a34aba7f43b000cad0c3cf794b7479ecWlVTVApaBVVSBAVUDQ9TUV1UVAERBANbUFBSU1FXVQ9fBlEBUFULUFo','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','','','','

Method I. Noticing that x – y is a common factor in Column A, we factor it out: x(x – y) – z(x – y) = (x – y)(x – z). Hence, the columns are equal, and the answer is (C).

Method II. Sometimes a complicated expression can be simplified by making a substitution. In the expression x(x – y) – z(x – y) replace x – y with w:

xw – zw

Now, the structure appears much simpler. Factoring out the common factor w yields

w(x – z)

Finally, re-substitute x – y for w:

(x – y)(x – z)

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7232','692','If (x – y)2 = x2 + y2, then which of the following statements must ... ...','null','468f3861c39a34e0319f4a6252a59627bb67ebabUQAAAFdRUlMGBVMDBQBQVA8PAFERUgUCBwRTAw0OAwMEBloFA1VTWVA','','','','null','ff6121d191b68368f27770f359c9096e22a34a3aUgAAUldWUlNRA1JWBggEBFxUAFIqXxAbWgQMXElfSwdfXEHU46YZBFRZXx1YGgRaWxoKR0dAWwRZTUVCEwcQDkZdBA8PG1hNVw9fChBASQYDCE4XEUVfF04TClFfDhwKSgdbCV9KRUNYU11NQhYUXB5CFV4GWxlPWV0CDERaBxcRW1MUVF8JWgoVX1kEGUNHBxUED1QNEBESDxRFFxVYVEJbQQYBFRVFEFYJFAUAAwVQW1UOUwAGVlRTAFEFAlcD','','','','   x = 0','   y = 0','   xy = 0','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','','','','

(x – y)2 = x2 + y2

by the formula x2 – 2xy + y2 = (x – y)2

–2xy = 0

by subtracting x2 and y2 from both sides of the equation

xy = 0

by dividing both sides of the equation by –2

Hence, Choice (C) is true. However, Choice (B) is false. For example, if y = 5 and x = 0, then xy = 0 · 5 = 0. A similar analysis shows that Choice (A) is false. The answer is (C).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7233','692','If x and y are prime numbers such that x > y > 2, then x2 – ... ...','null','16a8e774db688b2b5a399c4d7f2cea41bb38477dVQNWAlYBV1NRU1xXUl0HAVgHA1IQXFFSB1JSUwFSAANXA1YDCVJUVVI','','','','null','','','','','   3','   4','   5','   9','   12','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','','','

Method I:

The Difference of Squares formula yields x2 – y2 = (x + y)(x – y). Now, both x and y must be odd because 2 is the only even prime and x > y > 2. Remember that the sum (or difference) of two odd numbers is even. Hence, (x + y)(x – y) is the product of two even numbers and therefore is divisible by 4. To show this explicitly, let x + y = 2p and let x – y = 2q. Then (x + y)(x – y) = 2p · 2q = 4pq. Since we have written (x + y)(x – y) as a multiple of 4, it is divisible by 4. The answer is (B).

Method II (substitution):

Let x = 5 and y =3, then x > y > 2 and x2 – y2 = 52 – 32 = 25 – 9 = 16. Since 4 is the only number listed that divides evenly into 16, the answer is (B).

','','','','2011-11-18 22:08:17','0','0','0','11','0');

Since radicals are awkward to work with, let’s square both sides of this equation to eliminate the radical:

Applying the Perfect Square Trinomial Formula to the left side and simplifying the right side yields

x2 + 2xy + y2 = 4xy

Subtracting 4xy from both sides yields

x2 – 2xy + y2 = 0

Using the Perfect Square Trinomial Formula again yields

(x – y)2 = 0

Taking the square root of both sides yields Simplifying yields

Simplifying yields

x – y = 0

Finally, adding y to both sides yields

x = y

The answer is (C).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7246','693','If p = z + 1/z and q = z – 1/z, where z is a real number not equal ... ...','null','21fe1f5dc46731d5ac69efa20ee0caf51bfa8423WwUAAwMBBgBVVgBVAg8DVgpQVwAQVVcCClVXU1NRAAQHAwBVUgECVAs','','','','null','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','','','Since we are given that p = z + 1/z and q = z – 1/z,

p + q = (z + 1/z) + (z – 1/z) = z + 1/z + z – 1/z = 2z.

p – q = (z + 1/z) – (z – 1/z) = z + 1/z – z + 1/z = 2/z.

Therefore, (p + q)(p – q) = (2z)(2/z) = 4. The answer is (B).

','','','','2011-11-18 22:08:17','0','0','0','11','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('7247','693','Column A Column B   x2 + y2 (x + y)2','null','21e3f862c7426930793cb3a38568512d0e7eac21W1IADwMCVgAGVAYAVQFZUApXBFBCVQpSVwoADlxRAgVVVVQGVlVVUwk','','','','null','','','','','A is larger','B is larger','Both columns are equal','Not enough information to decide','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','','','','','From the Perfect Square Trinomial formula, Column B becomes

(x + y)2 = x2 + y2 + 2xy

This shows that (x + y)2 differs from x2 + y2 by 2xy. (Note that 2xy may be positive, negative, or zero.)

If 2xy is positive, (x + y)2 is greater than x2 + y2. (Because a number added to x2 + y2 made it as large as (x + y)2.)

If 2xy is negative, (x + y)2 is less than x2 + y2. (Because a number subtracted from x2 + y2 made it as small as (x + y)2.)

Since 2xy can be positive or negative, we cannot determine which is the greater of the two terms. The answer is (D).

Method II (Substitution):

Let y =0:

 

Column A

Column B

 

x2 + 02

(x + 0)2

Reducing yields

 

x2

x2

In this case, the columns are equal.

Next, let y = 1 and x = 1:

 

Column A

Column B

 

12 + 12

(1 + 1)2

Performing the operations yields

 

1 + 1

22

Performing the operations yields

 

2

4

In this case, the columns are not equal. This is a double case, and the answer is (D).

','','2011-11-18 22:08:17','0','0','0','12','0');
