In choice (B), the construction have it junked is awkward. Further, it changes the original construction from active to passive.

Choice (C) offers a parallel construction (repairing/junking), but it is awkward.

Choice (D) also offers a parallel construction (repair/junk), but the construction try and is not idiomatic.

Choice (E) offers a parallel construction (repair/junk), and the correct idiom—try to. The answer is (E).

','2012-01-26 13:57:03','0','0','0','0','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8126','739','    Jurassic Park, written by Michael Crichton, and which ... ...','null','d4b3a160a1d07d1ab7ba340232406ba9ee00af37AABZDwJTUlxRAFRWV10FAA8OBwdDCwNSBApXUlNVAFZdVlEHAABUA1Q','','','','null','','','','','   Jurassic Park, written by Michael Crichton, and which was first printed in 1988,','   Jurassic Park, written by Michael Crichton and first printed in 1988,','   Jurassic Park, which was written by Michael Crichton, and which was first printed in 1988,','   Written by Michael Crichton and first printed in 1988, Jurassic Park','   Jurassic Park, which was written by Michael Crichton and first printed in 1988,','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','

Choice (A) is incorrect since the verb written is not parallel to the construction which was … printed.

Choice (B) is the correct answer since the sentence is concise and the verb written is parallel to the verb printed.

Choice (C) does offer a parallel structure (which was written/which was printed); however, choice (B) is more concise.

Choice (D) rambles. The introduction Written by … 1988 is too long.

Choice (E) also offers a parallel structure (which was written/[which was] printed); however, choice (B) again is more concise. Note that which was need not be repeated for the sentence to be parallel.

','','','','','','2012-01-26 13:57:03','0','0','0','0','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8127','740','   In the past few years and to this day, many teachers ... ...','null','1abc437683825674437550359770ac929a83c86cUFUCVFVbBlQAAlNWAQBTUw4GVQBDUQIDBApRUwJZWwxTC1ANA1deB1A','','','','null','62e7eabcfa887e73a3edd7cd7cb519d8ba78f3d3UQMEU1ZQBFUNUVMEBQ9WBw9XAwHxlPvFpMF4WhgRWl1ERAdLERBWXEUXHAAEQUQRWA9TRkVYF0FeCEZEV1VASUYMUFpBRUZdBVcOXRdDEFZUFwgEEVsXUFcFFxVSXlJbVQQVDFJQGQYODkJRVkVGV0RGA0wQQl4ZRlhFEQ1WF0FLCEEHRVIXRlMCQQtBGhkBUQJVA1sHBwldUF5aBAcIXwFTVg','','','','   had chosen to return to the private sector.','   having chosen to return to the private sector.','   chose to return to the private sector.','   have chosen to return to the private sector.','   have chosen returning to the private sector.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','

Choice (A) is incorrect because it uses the past perfect had chosen, which describes an event that has been completed before another event. But the sentence implies that teachers have and are continuing to return to the private sector. Hence, the present perfect tense should be used.

Choice (B) is incorrect because it uses the present progressive tense having chosen, which describes an ongoing event. Although this is the case, it does not capture the fact that the event began in the past.

Choice (C) is incorrect because it uses the simple past chose, which describes a past event. But again, the sentence implies that the teachers are continuing to opt for the private sector.

Choice (D) is the correct answer because it uses the present perfect have chosen to describe an event that occurred in the past and is continuing into the present.

Choice (E) is incorrect because it leaves the thought in the sentence uncompleted.

','','','','','','2012-01-26 13:57:03','0','0','0','1','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8128','740','    Most of the homes that were destroyed in last summer’s ... ...','null','c390e364f70d8d9377c128e718e89a2c8f850bfdUAxYAApbBVFQUlQDAgBQUAoPBAERBA4EVVVcA1kPVwoBWlZcDQIDUlc','','','','null','04ff3ed5d7a1be8aef4968e7ea5f0b57bd429d11UgAEDwFWUFxXUlZbVV1RBgwBAl33laPF8pUWfltHQEJeVRMXWlZCC15ZAEoSQQtZF0JFXBMAEFBQREBKWkwEARBcWBNYVUcWEUBGDl9WEIGxrRYZUEcWSwtCVFATAEMUQlJGXRVXFAxcQRZEXUBcQkZcXAcfQAoCWlFFS11aBUtNQgQBBFJVVQBRBFoAAgMBBAcPVwUF','','','','   Most of the homes that were destroyed in last summer’s brush fires were','   Last summer, brush fires destroyed most of the homes that were','   Most of the homes that were destroyed in last summer’s brush fires had been','   Most of the homes that the brush fires destroyed last summer’s have been','   Most of the homes destroyed in last summer’s brush fires were being','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','

Choice (A) is incorrect because the simple past were does not express the fact that the homes had been built before the fire destroyed them.

Choice (B) merely rearranges the wording while retaining the simple past were.

Choice (C) is the correct answer because it uses the past perfect had been to indicate that the homes were completely built before they were destroyed by the fires.

Choice (D) is incorrect because it uses the present perfect have been, which implies that the homes were destroyed before being built.

Choice (E) is incorrect. Although dropping the phrase that were makes the sentence more concise, the past progressive were being implies that the homes were destroyed while being built.

','','','','','','2012-01-26 13:57:03','0','0','0','2','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8129','740','   Although World War II ended nearly a half century ago, ... ...','null','df06f8b3a1cbdcf6cde2193f95b2187e530c63c5V1BSUAtQUlFVVFYGVloDUQ8CBQEUAA1XVg4NVlQFXg5SDVdRVQ4AWwE','','','','null','','','','','   have not signed a formal peace treaty; and both countries have been','   did not signed a formal peace treaty; and both countries have been','   have not signed a formal peace treaty; and both countries being','   have not signed a formal peace treaty; and both countries are','   are not signing a formal peace treaty; and both countries have been','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','','

The sentence is grammatical as written. The present perfect verb have … signed correctly indicates that they have not signed a peace treaty and are not on the verge of signing one. Further, the present perfect verb have been correctly indicates that in the past both countries have been reluctant to develop closer relations and are still reluctant. The answer is (A).

In choice (B), the simple past did does not capture the fact that they did not sign a peace treaty immediately after the war and still have not signed one.

Choice (C) is very awkward, and the present progressive being does not capture the fact that the countries have been reluctant to thaw relations since after the war up through the present.

In choice (D), the present tense are leaves open the possibility that in the past the countries may have desired closer relations but now no longer do.

In choice (E), the present progressive tense are … signing, as in choice (D), leaves open the possibility that in the past the countries may have desired closer relations but now no longer do.

','','','','','2012-01-26 13:57:03','0','0','0','3','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8130','740','   The Democrats have accused the Republicans of resorting ... ...','null','67eb96896e30880941603e02c399cbf9b753a4bbVgUHAgRQUQAEAwZaV1kEAgAFU1wRAVEJVgJXAVsBAwQMVQUFVlhWUVc','','','','null','','','','','   used the information obtained to sabotage','   used the information they had obtained to sabotage','   of using the information they had obtained to sabotage','   using the information obtained to sabotage','   to have used the information obtained to sabotage','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','

Choice (A) is incorrect because the simple past obtained does not express the fact that the information was gotten before another past action—the sabotage.

Choice (B) is incorrect because used is not parallel to of resorting.

Choice (C) is correct because the phrase of using is parallel to the phrase of resorting. Further, the past perfect had obtained correctly expresses that a past action—the spying—was completed before another past action—the sabotage.

Choice (D) is incorrect because using is not parallel to of resorting and the past perfect is not used.

Choice (E) is incorrect because to have used is not parallel to of resorting and the past perfect is not used.

','','','','','','2012-01-26 13:57:03','0','0','0','4','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8131','745','Most students arrive at college using “discrete, concrete, and absolute ... ...','3','','','','','null','','','','','People who think “there is a right way and a wrong way to do things”','Teenagers who assume they know more about “the real world” than adults do','People who back our country “right or wrong” when it goes to war','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','ac','This is an extension question. Statement A is true. This is the essential characteristic of dualistic (right/wrong) thinkers. Statement B is false. Dualistic thinkers grant authority (right thinking) to adults and adult figures. This is clear from the sentence, “These students are slaves to the generalizations of their authorities.” Statement C is true since Dualistic thinkers believe their group is right and the other group is wrong. The answer, therefore, is (A) and (C).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:06:14','0','0','0','1','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8132','745','Most students arrive at [college] using “discrete, concrete, and absolute ... ...','3','','','','','null','9e19b5d8108b6c6036eb104c71374f691c42b668WwAEVQVSBVwBAVNaAVwAA18CDlYyRkcCAVYVFxgVUFZBAxdUQdK3qFxBBA9fQkJRVtO3pRUQCVgIX11BEhJfBx0YDwtMQlpcQQMHXQQQQ1sYRxATRl5ETBVFX11cFkFTA1hRVgdBEgULVhcNVgFRVwYOHBEDVVRVTUcAUgYFVQ8EAgAMU1JYAAUAClFXBAo','','','','most of their beliefs cannot be supported by arguments.','they have accepted their “truths” simply because authorities have said these things are “true.”','they half-believe and half-disbelieve just about everything.','their teachers almost always think that “dualistic” thinkers are wrong.','they are enslaved by their authorities.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','This is a description question. (A) is false. After carefully thinking through their reasons, committed thinkers are reasonably sure of their position. (B) is also false. Relativistic thinkers make sense of the world, but they have not chosen their position; indeed they cannot even choose a position. (C) is true. Multiplicity thinkers see the world as randomly organized; they can’t see the relationships that connect different positions.','','This is another extension question. Dualistic thinkers probably cannot give cogent arguments for their beliefs since they have adopted them unquestioningly from authority figures; dualistic thinkers do not know (have never thought of) the reasons for which their beliefs are right or wrong. Hence the answer is (B).','','','','2012-01-26 15:07:08','0','0','0','2','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8133','745','Most students arrive at [college] using “discrete, concrete, and absolute ... ...','3','','','','','null','4b8b56e02be0282e35edae7fd581679b19f8e492UgVQDwcCCgUGU1NUAlwFUQoFAlA1WgoFX0NZVwNEDQUWTF1XEABdDV1eRlBaBhkAQRBSREINCw1AE11GQkEWFkcMRE0DAEIBTxhBWlVGQgBCQlBeUV5YBAUFUwMOVVJUClEFDAQKBlIOUQ','','','','Committed thinkers are not very sure of their positions.','Relativistic thinkers have learned how to make sense out of the world and have chosen their own positions in it.','Multiplicity thinkers have difficulty understanding the relationships between different points of view.','Dualistic thinkers have thought out the reasons for taking their positions.','Dualistic thinkers fear the power of authority.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:07:35','0','0','0','3','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8134','745','Most students arrive at [college] using “discrete, concrete, and absolute ... ...','3','','','','','null','','','','','there are so many different kinds of people in a democracy.','in an “ideal” democracy, all people are considered equal; by extension, so are their opinions.','Democrats generally do not have a good sense of direction.','although democracies may grant freedom, they are generally acknowledged to be less efficient than more authoritarian forms of government.','in a democracy the individual has ultimate authority over himself, not the state.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','This is an extension question. Multiplicity students view all opinions as equally valid. They have yet to learn how to rank opinions (truths)—all votes (thoughts) count equally. The answer is (B). Note, (C) is offered to humor Republicans. The test-makers sometimes run out of tempting wrong choices. Don’t dwell on such humorous nonsense.','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:07:59','0','0','0','4','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8135','745','In the final stage students manage diversity through individual commitment. ... ...','3','','','','','null','3340914f8c1d34b2bdff79798e8949c45b26750fAAwEB1VVVQECBwZSUQpQAQ5VVwQxCVhSWRUNWVwUXAUYEgxXFVMLDQ9XElgIUUYOX1kGQ0VdVxNDCwgPDQhfVhFcERd3e2dDXAMXUUdcBgQHGAxfRkIOABZHA0MWU1ZWCFRYVl9ZVAkIAVtUDQFRUQ5RUQJT','','','','People who assume that there is no right or wrong in any issue','People who make unreasoned commitments and stick by them','People who believe that right or wrong depends on the situation','People who commit themselves to a particular point of view after having considered several alternative concepts','People who think that all behavior can be accounted for by cause and effect relationships','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','e','This is another description question. (A): No, these are the Multiplists. (B): No, Dualists think this way. (C): No, this describes Relativists. Don’t confuse (A) and (C). Multiplists acknowledge no right or wrong; whereas Relativists acknowledge a morality, but one that is context dependent. (D): No, Committed thinkers fit this description rather nicely. Hence, by process of elimination, we have learned the answer is (E).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:08:25','0','0','0','5','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8136','745','Most students arrive at [college] using “discrete, concrete, and absolute ... ...','3','','','','','null','','','','','The students were locked into the relativist stage.','The students had not advanced beyond the dualist stage.','The students had at least achieved the multiplicity stage.','The students had reached the commitment stage.','We have no indication of which cognitive stage the students were in.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','This is an application question. Since all the students showed how the characters exemplified the same concept of “tragedy,” they must be working from a common definition of tragedy (the traditional one). They have accepted “authority’s” definition of tragedy and have shown how each character fits it. It never occurred to them that there may be other ways to view a tragedy. Hence they are all dualistic thinkers. The answer is (B).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:09:03','0','0','0','6','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8137','745','Most students arrive at college using “discrete, concrete, and absolute ... ...','3','','','','','null','32cf4658bcd9215c4b99942da27b20f9aacfe2faBVVUAVcCVwFWAwVRDV1QUwAAD1djW1AFWRFXWQMQWlAWFlhSRV9YDQoOQl4KBkQHB0AVE10AQgJLX1tXRxNNDlQRV0UBUVtfTANEXgpXFw4AQUFfAUEUBBFAAFRcWghVC1JYAANRC1ZXCFlWBVZQBFAD','','','','Four methods of thought are compared and contrasted.','It is shown how each of four types of thought evolved from each other.','Four methods of thought are presented, and each is shown to complement the other.','The evolution of thought from simplistic and provincial through considered and cosmopolitan is illustrated by four stages.','The evolution of thought through four stages is presented.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','e','This is a writing technique question. In each paragraph the author shows how a stage of thought evolved from a previous stage—except the dualistic stage, which starts the analysis. Hence the answer is (E). Be careful not to choose (D). Although dualistic thinking certainly is simplistic and provincial, and committed thinking seems to be considered and cosmopolitan, neither of these judgments is stated nor implied by the passage.','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:09:36','0','0','0','7','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8138','745','A growing taste for shark steaks and shark-fin soup has for the first time ... ...','3','','','','','null','8bb3fe4612a041fc17e4abdeaebfb8555f29510eAVJWAAIFUFAEBFZRUgpSB1oDVwZ4BlsORAUKXQVERQoSFVBQRBFREhEHUFMdRhBcUUZZExZdQ0APVBUKVgtLQVcTBhMDEBECQARZQQETEBMLFVwWRQ4CWhBXXVdGQlxFFlkAF1AKVhIWAwZQAxFCAFMDXFAFBFIHAF4CAwQAUQ0FBQJW','','','','sharks are now being eaten more than cod.','the shark reproduction rate is lower than that of the cod.','sharks are quickly becoming fewer in number.','sharks are now as scarce as bald eagles and buffalo.','sharks are scavengers and therefore more susceptible to disease.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','This is a description question. Paragraph 3 contains the information needed to answer it. There it is stated that the cod population can replenish itself in a few years, but the shark population would take 15 years. Hence the answer is (B). Don’t make the mistake of choosing (C). Although it is certainly supported by the passage, it does not state how this relates to cod—they too may be decreasing in number. (C) uses the true-but-irrelevant ploy.','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:10:37','0','0','0','8','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8139','745','A growing taste for shark steaks and shark-fin soup has for the first time ... ...','3','','','','','null','d3d5d067665284b45520676c7232c329a511e674UVEAA1JVBVIDVFJUUQ0FC10OUgB0XF5EWQAARxkDCVoZC18XQVBVFVMLEkIERBZVXwtfVQBGSBkFVgBFRFZcUlMQRVRVDkVCUQVNF1RIQFlLS2w/bDx3VVQLRFIMWwMZEFdEEV9WEEdRFxZUXgdJFlhEXVJWSlVUQQBBXA8WRV5WFl0WFVoUTAhZEAxYXUMBB1IGAgtRV1UKVgBWAAkBUARSVQ','','','','might cause some fish populations to go unchecked.','would hamper cancer research.','to one-quarter the current level would take over a decade to recover from.','undefined','undefined','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','ac','This is a description question. Statement A is true. It is supported by the analogy drawn between lions and sharks (lines 7–9). Statement B is false. It is too strong an inference to draw from the information in lines 9–11. If sharks were on the verge of extinction, this “could hamper” research. But given that the author does not claim or imply that sharks are near extinction, “would hamper” is too strong. Besides, the author does not state that sharks are being used in research, just that they may be useful in that regard. Statement C is true. In paragraph 3, a comparison is drawn between sharks and cod fish. It states that if ¾ were cut out of the shark population, it would take 15 years to recover – that’s over a decade, so C is true. Thus, the answer is (A) and (C).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:11:20','0','0','0','9','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8140','745','But can U.S. quotas save shark species that wander the whole Atlantic? ... ...','3','','','','','null','43e2346710f6e9f6602f05a12dd818710d6e90d4VAxQUFJTV1YEBwJVVw1UBwoCAQZ4VRIVXVFCQxVdUVxQRBAuVlwJRVtXVg8CRRcSR1YVFwdQQVBBWV4NVFcSFVoUAFVFTltDXEdRFFZEFUVWVlVGFV9EWlFBAxcGTUFHVllSD0gTXg5CFARVBk1cUVxDSUZLUBIARBheCEFcBVxUG0ZABhVYXFRcQ0NUS0IEVkBCRA1ZRgUAVgFUXVVeVA8PAFYFBgELAFNS','','','','Homo logicus could overpopulate its niche and should be controlled.','Homo logicus might be declared an endangered species.','Homo logicus would pose no danger to other species and would itself be in no danger.','Homo logicus would soon become extinct.','None of these events would be expected with certainty.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','e','This is an application question; we are asked to apply what we have learned in the passage to a hypothetical situation. A review of the passage shows that only (B) and (E) have any real merit. But sharks have survived for 400 million years with an extremely low fecundity rate. This eliminates (B). Hence the answer is (E).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:11:44','0','0','0','10','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8141','745','But can U.S. quotas save shark species that wander the whole Atlantic? ... ...','3','','','','','null','944200089ef861e8525b5d90c33164363dda96baUAxUAFdWBVNRCVNRUAlTAQACUwFgXAoHDRZYWlAQVgUWFgwDFVdeD19XQl8KUhZVAEpDEwBUQVBLXQcBRBQXDAAWVkFBWFYR1OL9FRVQRRdaTEBSARVCWBJYRVdERVpWGVEDAlhGFxdFQlgURUJWF1MBEEZGWVARWBhFWRRAWlYRUFhdFw4HVwAEBlcEBVVQVgAEUFFRAFVUAw','','','','strong advocate','impartial observer','opposed','perplexed','resigned to their ineffectiveness','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','This is a rather easy tone question. The passage has a matter-of-fact or journalistic tone to it. So the answer is (B).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:12:50','0','0','0','11','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8142','745','But can U.S. quotas save shark species that wander the whole Atlantic? ... ...','3','','','','','null','d3d6df4610eb099ea653412defb5e9d1b40d94e7Ag1YDgsFBVFWAQBRDFxWUwECUlZ0X1tDW1NUQ0FXW1oYRQ0BGQEOWAhaXEsYB1hRQkIBX10HQ0FZWAgTQ1hURBJWQUENTxk7MjxvLU1CBVYPGVtdGA9YUwdDFlZcRFETV1lER19VFUBTREJQBlMXQlBQEVAIUAJSB1sMXQECB1dWAQAKDAEA','','','','research efforts on cancer will be hindered if shark populations are threatened.','U.S. quotas on shark fishing will have limited effectiveness in protecting certain species.','some practices of Chinese chefs have angered environmentalists.','undefined','undefined','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','This is an extension question. Statement A is incorrect. Like Statement B in Question 9, it overstates the case. Statement B is correct. We know from the passage that some species of sharks migrate into the waters of over 20 countries. U.S. quotas alone cannot “protect” these sharks, even if the quotas reduce the rate of killing in U.S. waters. Statement C is incorrect. The environmentalists are angry at the finning fishermen who are over-fishing the waters; there is nothing in the passage to suggest that this anger is also directed towards the chefs. The answer is (B).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:13:15','0','0','0','12','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8143','745','But can U.S. quotas save shark species that wander the whole Atlantic? ... ...','3','','','','','null','20c9c9dbf55cde21ed3dc6832612f64434e7d348AgYHBVZTUlEMVAZSBgxQV1oDAVUnWBIPQF9dTxRCB0IXXRJeWwVFAxNdCxMRWAQVWQoMX0daUgAOUFlERkJaB0YQQF5VQglCQkYPW1lCBwBBQgpSBlUFFVcKQkRaUREIAltWVwNSEgpbQ0cWXUMBB1oCVAEEUANTVQZVBwAHBQYMXA','','','','we will now find out less about cancer, so in effect by saving the sharks, we are hurting ourselves.','sharks are far more dangerous to other fish than we are to them.','more chefs are now using the cartilaginous tissues found in shark fins.','more sharks are being killed now than before the announcement.','man will now protect a creature that he has been the victim of.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','By announcing the impending classification, the federal government ironically encourages fishermen to kill as many sharks as they can before the regulations go into effect—stimulating the opposite of what was intended, i.e., the saving of sharks. The answer is (D).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:13:39','0','0','0','13','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8144','745','“A writer’s job is to tell the truth,” said Hemingway in 1942. “I ... ...','3','','','','','null','5e6e453e38cf791f697394a99589df7cdc7d6d68W1ZZVQMAUFINAFFVUg0HBgoBDgAgWwJfFAVYDFUYQ14SRwoBEFNNRlANSk8QKwZbUF5SQAdMhLSqRBgVE1EMURQYERJHSkdeQVZCDV4STFdUDlENV0MCFkpEWkUfFRFVQA4MBFgBVAhfBVdVUVxUBlYFBlII','','','','to construct a well-told story that the reader would thoroughly enjoy.','to construct a story that would reflect truths that were not particular to a specific historical period.','to begin from reality but to allow his imagination to roam from “the way it was” to “the way it might have been.”','to report faithfully reality as Hemingway had experienced it.','to go beyond the truth, to “create” reality.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','This is a description question. (A) is false. The enjoyment of the reader was incidental to Hemingway’s primary purpose—truth-telling. (B) is false, though very tempting. The first half of this item “to construct a story that would reflect truths” looks very good. The second half, however, spoils it by adding the qualifier “not particular to a specific historical period.” Reviewing the passage reveals no indication that Hemingway is trying to create any kind of “general truth.” In fact, one can argue that Hemingway’s emphasis on developing a strong “sense of place” and his belief that when trying to tell the truth “I only know what I have seen” support the inference that Hemingway sees truth as subjective, not objective. (C) is also false. The passage gives no indication that Hemingway was interested in the way things “might have been.” (D) is true. This is clearly the author’s interpretation of Hemingway’s purpose. Look at the first few sentences of both the first and the second paragraphs. Notice that this question item emphasizes subjective truth, or the truth “as Hemingway had experienced it.” Strategy: In this question, you have two choices—(B) and (D)—which at first glance seem very close. Let’s assume you don’t understand exactly why a “close second” is wrong. When confronted with this situation, it’s a good idea to take a few seconds and try to get into the Question-Writer’s mindset. What are you missing that the Question-Writer thinks is an important point in this passage? In this case, the Question-Writer is focusing on the subtle point that Hemingway sees his perspective as “subjective,” that certain things, true in some places or to some people, may not be true in other places or to other people. In other words, there is no “objective reality.” If intuition is the only way to distinguish between the two close choices, then you should make a note on your scratch paper, noting the question number and two answer choices you had to choose from. With the new GRE format, you can return to questions to change your answers if need be. If you have trouble with later questions on the same passage, you may want to go back, analyze the passage, and determine the real difference between the earlier “close pair.” The Question-Writer may be testing the same question from a different angle, in which case time is well spent pondering the issue.','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:14:31','0','0','0','14','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8145','745','This landscape is as morning-fresh as a design in India ink on clean white ... ...','3','','','','','null','','','','','He felt that geography in some way illuminated other, more important events.','He thought readers generally did not have enough imagination to visualize the scenes for themselves.','He had no other recourse since he was avoiding the use of other literary sources.','He thought that landscapes were more important than characters to convey “the way it was.”','He felt that without background information the readers would be unable to follow the story.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','This is an extension question. Hemingway effectively equates geography with background, and says that without them “you have nothing.” The author refers to the “geographical groundwork” of Hemingway’s novels. Both of these statements imply that details of place set the stage for other, more important events. Hence the answer is (A). Don’t try to draw a distinction between “geography,” “background,” and “landscape.” The author uses them interchangeably when referring to details of place. Such latitude with labels is often mimicked by the Question-Writers. Choice (D) is a close second-best. The author indicates that geography, background, and landscape are quite important to Hemingway. In fact, “first” in the opening to paragraph 3 almost indicates that details of place are the most important aspect of his writing. Looking closely, however, we see that the passage gives no indication of Hemingway’s perspective on characters. So no comparison can be made.','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:15:02','0','0','0','15','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8146','745','This landscape is as morning-fresh as a design in India ink on clean white ... ...','3','','','','','null','662c42e22cc0d70e4e5abc339260cfb4cc109521Vg0EAFAAUgcEAwEAUABZAgoCA1EqV1ESDF5QCRJDCgwFBENEVEZZCBVNDVNDEwAQQ1ICB0RMUFFHFH1RCFBaVRZWTkEWEQYEBhNDAVYUQQ1cWg0WDA0EQ19VRRYMXRhWXFhZWxJQWlVBRFgUFAAGEUMHXhYSXF8WFVcKQAYPEkNRXQFCF1BXQkcURkAKS11XEghVAlVQWlBVUVICUABVBgQJXANRUg','','','','Stories that he had heard from friends or chance acquaintances','Stories that he had read about in newspapers or other secondary sources','Stories that came to him in periods of meditation or in dreams','Stories that he had lived rather than read about','Stories adapted from myths','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','Hemingway’s primary intent was to project for the reader “the way it was,” as seen through his eyes. The answer is (D).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:15:30','0','0','0','16','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8147','745','This landscape is as morning-fresh as a design in India ink on clean white ... ...','3','','','','','null','','','','','The comparison of “the designer’s initials” to the man who fell and lay in the gutter (bold, last paragraph) during the running of the bulls','Hemingway’s stated intent to project for the reader “the way it was” (bold, 2nd paragraph)','Hemingway’s ability to invent fascinating tales from his own experience','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','ab','This is an extension question. Statement A is true. The last line of the passage states that the designer’s initials (i.e., the writer’s presence) are made as inconspicuous as possible. Statement B is also true. Readers cannot see “the way it was” if they are looking through another medium (the author). Hemingway appears to say, in effect: “I’m striving to report exactly what happened (and not my opinions about it). The readers must draw their own conclusions.” Statement C is false. In fact, a good case could be made that writing only from personal experience would tend to increase, not decrease, the presence of the writer in his writings. The answer is (A) and (B).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:16:31','1','0','0','17','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8148','745','This landscape is as morning-fresh as a design in India ink on clean white ... ...','3','','','','','null','af48fa6f582cf9e0921899f38848e309d300dd53UANZDgNRV1MGCFIGAwtXCgEPVFd/Fl5eEERdAxcUBBdBVFdQGhdYDVYXW1leEgVEQU1bARdHXllMGRVaUAdZE19WFRJfAUUCXVlcWkFeWQQTRExZRFcJUlxMRURAXENUXBkAV0oQEVdVQ1YUXgYARHpQXVxYUEACStW4oUMSBUNGUUIRU1YWTFdOA0BdRFpdX0dZA1MDAFsLDFYGDg8DW1YECAFUAVQHVlwDVw','','','','One can learn about life only by living it fully.','A wise person will read widely in order to learn about life.','Knowledge is a powerful tool that should be reserved only for those who know how to use it.','Experience is a poor teacher.','One can never truly \"know\" anything.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','This is an application question; we are asked to put ourselves in Hemingway’s mind. From Hemingway’s statement “I only know what I have seen” and from the author’s assertion that Hemingway refused to honor secondary sources, we can infer that he believed one can “know” only through experience. Hence the answer is (A).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:17:03','1','0','0','18','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8149','745','This landscape is as morning-fresh as a design in India ink on clean white ... ...','3','','','','','null','af8423069c16e00a14c0054d503937463114b354BgxSAFJUAgECVAJVAVkEAAFQB1A1XwZBWRNCCV4REAIACglEQdS4qBFQVhYWVkhFXxBGQFQSh7KlRlAVg7f/AlAHRABSF1UTCBURXgJXVFgcGEBfDEddABYUDkVUEgASXglDFQAXAA5WBVMRRUNfB0EDHUMTV1dGAVFdVxNOEQZZCRZbUBkMRkGEsahBVQYCWRNFBAFWBAVUVlYOUgEMAlYJAgIDBARR','','','','the phrase reflects Hemingway’s talent for obscuring ordinary events.','the relationship between simplicity and complexity reflected the relationship between the style and content of Hemingway’s writing.','Hemingway became increasingly confused about “the way it was” throughout the course of his career.','Hemingway’s obsession for geographic details progressively overshadowed the dramatic element of his stories.','it typifies how Hemingway understated complex issues.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','','','This is an extension question. The answer is (B). There is a great parallel here. Phrase (in the passage) corresponds to style (in the answer-choice), and concept corresponds to content.','','','','2012-01-26 15:17:24','1','0','0','19','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8150','745','Imagine that we stand on any ordinary seaside pier, and watch the waves ... ...','3','','','','','null','','','','','It seems reasonable to assume that red light would surround the sun because the sun is basically a large fireball.','It seems reasonable to assume that the other colors of light would either cancel each other or combine to produce red.','It seems reasonable to assume that red light would not be disturbed by the atmospheric particles and would consequently reach us by a relatively direct path from the sun to our eyes.','It is not supported by the passage. The author does not say what color of light should be near the sun, and he provides no reasons that would allow us to assume that the light would be red.','Gazing directly at the sun forces the eye to focus on the longer red waves.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','This is an extension question. According to the passage, red light would not be significantly deflected and consequently would pass through a relatively direct route from the sun to our eyes. Hence the answer is (C).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:19:38','1','0','0','20','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8151','745','Imagine that we stand on any ordinary seaside pier, and watch the waves ... ...','3','','','','','null','96f482cb689fb33f00a78d3f6c3b3918c9e32497VlVXAwdWA1cHBAZXVwBRBA9VUlI2UlFVCEVfEURBGApREFVGXlVGAEcXU1EUQVhSRxQRXQxKRFNEQxNWE1RUVQhWQgoQXlEFWBIQDlBEFQhaE1MVUVtVQVRNQkELWV4WWgwKUABDGEcHR1MOVVxfFlhGXA9WX0FLFSdEWlkVRFtaR0JCBhhTV1hDB1gLUlRFAlQWFlhTTFpUVVZQUgRXVgxQDlYNUAMBBw1V','','','','red light will exert more energy when it hits the surface of the earth than will blue light.','lightning is caused by the collision of blue light with particles in the air.','red light will travel faster than blue light.','blue light has more energy than red light.','blue light has less energy than red light.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','This is another extension question. Since the passage is a science selection, we should expect a lot of extension questions. (A): No, if anything, blue light would exert more energy. (B): No. We cannot infer this. The collision of blue light with particles in the air is the reason for a blue sky, not for lightning. (C): No. Speed of light is not mentioned in the passage. (D): Yes. Blue light has a shorter wavelength, consequently it has more energy than red light.','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:21:23','1','0','0','21','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8152','745','Imagine that we stand on any ordinary seaside pier, and watch the waves ... ...','3','','','','','null','','','','','Blue light waves act like ripples that other blue light waves meet and scatter from.','Red light waves will be scattered by blue light waves like incoming long water waves are scattered by outgoing ripples.','Red light waves can scatter blue light waves, but blue light waves cannot scatter red.','The analogy between water and light waves cannot be extended to include the way in which short water waves become ripples and scatter one another.','The scattering effect of blue light waves is canceled by that of red.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','This is an application question since it introduces new information about water waves and asks us to conclude how the behavior of light waves might be similarly affected. Given this information, however, we can justify no conclusion about whether light waves imitate water waves in this new regard. The analogy might hold or it might break down. We don’t yet know. (To find out we would have to do an experiment using light.) The answer is (D).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:21:44','1','0','0','22','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8153','745','Imagine that we stand on any ordinary seaside pier, and watch the waves ... ...','3','','','','','null','94f052387b637613743b6ee4a03598dd046872e6UlJVVVUGClxVU1MEBVxYVAsBAFRvWFpaCURaD1FEC1VDFQpQF1dcDV0JQwoIAhlREkNWRkMBWBVdWRZXV0ITWBIXQAxdCgMTFwkDQRdCRg9dD1MLEkVQS0EAWAhCEFASR0NTVRhfVRkWBUMER0QLVUMMA1tOEVAOXQlGEFlTXF1VAgdVBF0BAlYHAgcABwFcVw','','','','The mixture of waves that make up sunlight has to struggle through a variety of obstacles in the atmosphere.','When passing through water in the atmosphere, sunlight is sometimes broken down into an array of colors.','Many different wavelengths of light enter our eyes from all directions.','The mere fact that light waves can be scattered is a reason for assuming that sunlight is constituted of waves of different colors.','When passing through dust in the atmosphere, sunlight is sometimes broken down into an array of colors.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','(A): No. We do not know anything about a “variety” of obstacles; even if we did, we would have no reason to assume that light is constituted of different colors. (B): Yes. Rainbows occur because light is constituted of many colors. (C): No. This is a distortion of the passage, and it sounds illogical to boot. (D): No. This gives no reason to assume that light is constituted of many colors. (E): No. Water vapor in the atmosphere causes rainbows, not dust.','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:22:28','1','0','0','23','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8154','745','Imagine that we stand on any ordinary seaside pier, and watch the waves ... ...','3','','','','','null','deb86b118bbd70ede5641303342e6045437015d6VQxYA1BSBAIGA1UEBlpYBAoGBFInSlgPGEBbBhRbCgIOQl1UF14MCBZIS1AQVFkSV1cRD1xCTV5WEEJWEktWBV0YExRcUxBEAlFeFRRSQwVZVlpZFlVSRlNRXhNGQk1eVhBRWA1XRUJXUhMXXFdEFwpJEFoNFwJGUllAFRRYQw4SUhEKUxBeUxNBR1YPTF4WQRRcBRRWERcVEFlbQ0MLAxZZUEdcAARWAQAFVFdUCQIGBAEAUQkCBg4','','','','The sky would be even bluer','The sky would be redder','The sky would not change colors','We do not have enough information to determine a change in color','The sky would assume a violet hue','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','(A): No. Although dust is mentioned as one of the three important obstacles, we simply do not have enough information to conclude how dust density would change sky color. (B): No. While this idea may fit with the common lore that a lot of dust in the air creates great, red sunsets, the passage itself gives no basis to any conclusion regarding color change. (C): No. Same reason as in (A) and (B). (D): Yes. There is not enough information in the passage to determine a relationship between color change and dust density. The dust may give off a certain color of its own—we can’t say for certain.','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:22:55','1','0','0','24','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8155','745','Imagine that we stand on any ordinary seaside pier, and watch the waves ... ...','3','','','','','null','','','','','Light meets more obstacles when passing parallel to the earth’s surface than when traveling perpendicular. Consequently, even red light is diffused.','The blue light may not make it through the denser pathway of the evening sky, leaving only the long light waves of red.','The short red light waves have more energy and are the only waves that can make it through the thick atmosphere of the evening sky.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','ab','Statement (A) is true. There are obviously more particles on a horizontal than a vertical path. The glowing red sky is reasonable evidence for some diffusion. Note that Question 24 asks “what can we conclude” while this question asks what seems plausible (what “would seem to be explained”). So, while we are attempting to make very similar inferences in both questions, what we can do with the data depends, among other things, on the degree of certainty requested. Statement (B) is true. The path of evening light probably has a greater average density, since it spends more time passing through a zone of thicker atmosphere. It is reasonable to assume this significantly greater density, or the absolute number of particles, might present an obstacle to blue light. Statement (C) is false. There are two things wrong with this answer: (1) red light waves are not short, relative to blue; (2) we do not know that waves with more energy will more readily pass through obstacles. The passage, in fact, implies just the opposite. The answer is (A) and (B).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:23:31','1','0','0','25','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8156','745','Imagine that we stand on any ordinary seaside pier, and watch the waves ... ...','3','','','','','null','655e7d456ff2b09fd09946efdf9f3fd1f807f302UwMFUwZSAFVRVQEEBVlSUAwFAFZkXggBWRFXDQMXXQJERlhRFVNdXVxYEwxbVhNVCgAWRkUJVkJURkJbXERBEVRUVUMSWBINCUJcTQoBBFRWUwJcUwJVVVQDXVYGBwBSBw','','','','Waves of light and waves of water are identical.','Waves of light have the same physical shape as waves of water.','Waves of light and waves of water do not have very much in common.','Waves of water are only models of waves of light.','There are colors of light waves just as there are colors of water waves.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','(A): No. Water waves offer only a model for light waves. As a model, they are identical in some ways but not in others. (B): No. This is not implied by the passage. What they have in common is the way they act when they impinge on obstacles. (C): No. Waves of water are used as a model because they have much in common with waves of light. (D): Yes. See explanation for (A).','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:24:29','1','0','0','26','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8157','746','From Romania to Germany, from Tallinn to Belgrade, a major historical process—the ... ...','1','','','','','null','da762f9d76fb8ccb740b8923a2eae82484780c7aU1cAUAcHBVUCUQFRVQkDUwpTD1I8aW1QAENYREBYDUZBW0pYAQpdVlwPGEZADFlEUQkRExVZAxUTEVFSEQxLXAARGV5SEAdCBFpMQkYKXRdECwRGQBZXX0UHCkEMUBYIXAsZWFdDWlcIDkxfXUMWFBJbW1gDF0oXRwwUClBEVFQWEwBDE1QRBF0RXFMRAUAYEgtQUlwQDVoEFFdXRhdbUhAFDgpYC0FYWAZaC1gDUQABAFhSCVENAFFUAQFXBwM','','','','A great political shock would break the totalitarian monopoly, leaving in its wake a civil society whose task would be to change the state-controlled market into a free economy.','The transformation of the economy would destroy totalitarianism, after which a new and different social and political structure would be born.','First the people would freely elect political representatives who would transform the economy, which would then undermine the totalitarian structure.','The change to a democratic state would necessarily undermine totalitarianism, after which a new economic order would be created.','The people’s frustration would build until it spontaneously generated violent revolution, which would sentence society to years of anarchy and regression.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','This is a description question, so you should locate the point in the passage from which it was drawn. It is the third paragraph. In lines 23–28, the author recalls his expectation that, by introducing the market system, the communist system would topple from within.

Be careful not to choose (A). It chronicles how the events actually occurred, not how they were anticipated to occur. (A) is baited with the words “great shock,” “monopoly,” and “civil society.”

 

 

 

 

The answer is (B).

','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:49:57','0','0','0','1','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8158','746','From Romania to Germany, from Tallinn to Belgrade, a major historical process—the ... ...','1','','','','','null','','','','','A country can have freedom without having democracy.','If a country has freedom, it necessarily has democracy.','A country can have democracy without having freedom.','A country can never have democracy if it has freedom.','If a country has democracy, it cannot have freedom.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','This is an extension question, so the answer must say more than what is said in the passage, without requiring a quantum leap in thought. The needed reference is “We have freedom, but we still have not achieved the democratic order.” (2nd paragraph). Since freedom can exist without democracy, freedom alone does not ensure democracy.','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:50:39','0','0','0','2','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8159','746','From Romania to Germany, from Tallinn to Belgrade, a major historical process—the ... ...','1','','','','','null','','','','','Relieved that at last the democratic order has surfaced.','Clearly wants to return to the old order.','Disappointed with the nature of the democracy that has emerged.','Confident that a free economy will ultimately provide the basis for a true democracy.','Surprised that communism was toppled through political rather than economic means.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','This is a tone question. The key to answering this question is found in the closing comments. He clearly has reservations about the newly emerging democracies: “Yet, even as we are conscious of our victory, we feel that we are, in a strange way, losing.”

Watch out for (E). Although it is it is supported by the passage, it is in a supporting paragraph. The ideas in a concluding paragraph take precedence over those in a supporting paragraph.

The answer is (C).

','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:51:28','0','0','0','3','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8160','746','From Romania to Germany, from Tallinn to Belgrade, a major historical process—the ... ...','1','','','','','null','','','','','evidence that society is still in the throws of the old totalitarian structure.','a distorted description of the new political system.','a necessary political reality that is a prelude to “democracy.”','a fair description of many democratic political systems.','evidence of the baseness of people.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','This is an application question. These are like extension questions, but they go well beyond what is stated in the passage. In this case we are asked to interpret the author’s comments from a cynic’s perspective. Because application questions go well beyond the passage, they are often difficult, as is this one.

A cynic looks at reality from a negative perspective, usually with a sense of dark irony and hopelessness.

Don’t make the mistake of choosing (E). Although a cynic is likely to make such a statement, it does not address the subject of the passage—political and economic systems. The passage is not about human nature, at least not directly. The answer is (D).

','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:52:20','0','0','0','4','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8161','746','From Romania to Germany, from Tallinn to Belgrade, a major historical process—the ... ...','1','','','','','null','','','','','The people who existed under the totalitarian structure have not had the experience of “negotiating the empty space of freedom.”','Mistaking the order in which political, economic, and social restructuring would occur.','Excessive self-interest among the new political activists.','All of the above.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','','','','','This is an extension question. Statement A is true. The author implies that the institutions of the new-born, free society were created in great pain because the people lacked experience. Statement B is true. Expectations that the market mechanisms would explode totalitarianism and usher in a new society were dashed, and having to readjust one’s expectations certainly makes a situation more difficult. Finally, statement C is true. It summarizes the thrust of the passage’s closing lines. The answer is (D): all of the above.','','2012-01-26 15:53:28','0','0','0','5','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8162','746','From Romania to Germany, from Tallinn to Belgrade, a major historical process—the ... ...','1','','','','','null','b6131e5b735cb0311325ad1e67786e3fdc287facAAEHUgpTB1wDVAFbAF1RUwwFVQAgTkJBQwRDUQtTThjWs/hdQVAPQwJGRhNcEFVKUkQGVloWUwhaRhBFDVFCXUIXF04MVxZXRkpIGEBQQQUGUApETVhVTBcTABlVF1VNFVoNRQMXEUZFBFlfABQVWU0fRFRYRggNBNfm+RUQQFBSRARMQA1fExVeBgQMREJGXwRDWQEFBw4DBFwOUgYHBwAHXlNfUVc','','','','some of the old governments are still unwilling to grant freedom at the individual level.','some of the new governments are not strong enough to exist as a single federation.','some of the new democratic governments are electing to retain the old political parties.','no new parties have been created to fill the vacuum created by the victory of freedom.','some of the new governments are reverting to communism.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','This is a hybrid extension and description question. Because it refers to a specific point in the passage, you must read a few sentences before and after it.','','','','','','2012-01-26 15:54:22','0','0','0','6','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8163','746','Directions: This passage is followed by a group of questions to be answered ... ...','1','','','','','null','ccc1566ed4f9d68456d99b49cc109a052fad8471U1BYBwJUUlAHVgUBVwhRAQEFB1RiDV0FChgOCwYQXV4RFwoARVELDlwLTlhfUEFWVhUVQwZIQEFdQEJURkVADgcYDAQKXhJRVQYDRQpRRBZYARlBUEQSVVQDXloBBAlQWwIBCFRVAVQEWQVdVwcD','','','','The educational shortcomings of the United States, in contrast to those of Latin America, are merely the result of poor allocation of available resources.','Both education and medical care are severely underfunded.','Defense spending is sapping funds which would be better spent in education.','Obligatory schooling must be scrapped if the goal of educational equality is to be realized.','Obligatory education does not and cannot provide equal education.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','e','The answer to a main idea question will summarize the passage, without going beyond it. (A) fails to meet these criteria because it makes a false claim. Lines 33–38 imply that the discrepancy in allocation of funds is greater in Latin America. Besides, Latin America is mentioned only in passing, so this is not the main idea. (B) also makes a false claim. The author implies that increased funding for education is irrelevant, if not counterproductive. In fact, the sentence “The President’s committee for the study of school finance should ask not how to support or how to trim such increasing costs, but how they can be avoided” implies that he thinks an increase in funding would be counterproductive. (C) is implied by the sentence “The United States . . . is obviously too poor to provide equal schooling,” but the author does not fully develop this idea. Besides, he implies that the problem is not financial. (D) is the second-best answer-choice. The answer to a main idea question should sum up the passage, not make a conjecture about it. Clearly the author has serious reservations about obligatory schooling, but at no point does he state or imply that it should be scrapped. He may believe that it can be modified, or he may be resigned to the fact that, for other reasons, it is necessary. We don’t know. Finally, (E) aptly summarizes the passage, without going beyond it. The key to seeing this is the opening to paragraph three, “Equal obligatory schooling must be recognized as at least economically unfeasible.” In other words, regardless of any other failings, it cannot succeed economically and therefore cannot provide equal education.','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:00:47','0','0','0','7','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8164','746','Directions: This passage is followed by a group of questions to be answered ... ...','1','','','','','null','','','','','Education should not be obligatory at all.','Education should not be obligatory for those who cannot afford it.','More money should be diverted to education for the poorest.','undefined','undefined','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','This is an application question. These questions tend to be rather difficult, though this one is not. To answer an application question, put yourself in the author’s place. If you were arguing his case, which of the solutions would you advocate? As to (A), although we rejected the recommendation that obligatory education be eliminated as Question 1’s answer, it is the answer to Question 2. The author does not merely imply that obligatory education has some shortcomings; he suggests that it is fundamentally flawed. Again this is made clear by the opening to paragraph three, “Equal obligatory schooling must be recognized as at least economically unfeasible.” Still, there is a possible misunderstanding here: perhaps the author believes that obligatory education is a noble but unrealistic idea. This possibility, however, is dispelled by the closing paragraph in which he states that obligatory education polarizes society and sets up a caste system. Obviously, such a system, if this is true, should be discarded. (A) is true. The other choices can be easily dismissed. (B) is incorrect because nothing in the passage suggests that the author would advocate a solution that would polarize society even more. Indeed, at the end of paragraph three, he suggests that the rich already get more than their fair share. (C) is incorrect because it contradicts the author. Paragraph two is dedicated to showing that the United States is too poor to provide equal schooling. You can’t divert money you don’t have.','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:01:58','0','0','0','8','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8165','746','Directions: This passage is followed by a group of questions to be answered ... ...','1','','','','','null','2974d9222bc4d6445c5bbf073f0bd4493e8d4ac9VQ0DV1dXVlRSB1UGUV5RVwAOBFNyB1oLEABeXAYYFV1BQlgBFUIEF0VYBQRIFABUE1RQEAwJXkVQSxJaWg9cRAoBVl4VUEFRAERVRFxcRQVaVUIOAhQRWAMXVwsJCl8SUFZVFkQFQBdCIW9xJGg1CANQAFMGVFUGUg1WWFdRXVRSVlJd','','','','It has reached a point of diminishing returns, increased spending no longer results in significant improvement.','It has an inappropriate “more is better” philosophy.','It is unfairly distributed between rich and poor.','The amount of money being spent on older students is increasing.','Its cost has increased nearly as fast.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','This is a description question, so we must find the place from which it is drawn. It is the first paragraph. The sentence “But increased treatment by both doctors and teachers has shown steadily declining results” shows that both have reached a point of diminishing returns. This eliminates (A) and (B). Next, the passage states “Medical expenses concentrated on those above forty-five have doubled several times” (lines 5–7) and that the demand and costs of higher education are growing faster than the demand and costs of elementary and high school education. This eliminates (D). Next, the opening to the passage states that the costs of education “have risen almost as fast as the cost of medical treatment.” This eliminates (E). Hence, by process of elimination, the answer is (C). We should, however, verify this. In paragraph three, the author does state that there is a “keen” discrepancy in the funding of education between rich and poor, but a survey of the passage shows that at no point does he mention that this is also the case with health care.','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:02:46','0','0','0','9','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8166','746','Directions: This passage is followed by a group of questions to be answered ... ...','1','','','','','null','699f990b8f858eabe0a245bee5e9a5220ebee22eAlcHVFdTV1NWCV1XAg0DAAwEB1xnUBsQBg5SRURNWAASBUZCDl9LEgIMCBENVAFFQk1RUBZHB0FAXkVKEF4QXw9BXlgHS1UEQQFXFgNUTFEAFw8NClEIFwdBSVBYUQtGQEBUShBMDRAABBfU5KVVE1cKE0USQlhcBgYUgOStREMKWFcVQl0NQVASV0tfVUJZDAJFUwVKVQESCVZSD1NYXkEGHhIBXgBeFkxLUEUKVgdXV1QMVQEDBVBTB1MGXFVXAAE','','','','The aging of the population should have had an impact only on medical care, not on education.','The “Right to Read” should be a bare minimum, not a Presidential ideal.','Educational spending has shown even poorer results than spending on health care, despite greater increases.','Education has become even more discriminatory than health care.','It inevitably polarizes society.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','This is an extension question. We are asked to interpret a statement by the author. The needed reference is the closing sentence to paragraph one. Remember: extension questions require you to go beyond the passage, so the answer won’t be explicitly stated in the reference—we will have to interpret it.
