insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8176','747','Directions: This passage is followed by a group of questions to be answered ... ...','1','','','','','null','36ae601da3edf02b78125662061518f2c9d76371VQRZUFdbAFUBA1RSBw9TBgoCUwYsDEQCC1lZHEpeV1dDWEZDW1VSXNSwoRVEW0ZCQVxdUUFOEtazqBYMBgsFD0VIRwBDUldTBhWEtKkYR1pTEFkTEFBcQxVbX0BWRBJAXAFTVVdSUlJQCQ0DAlQAVFQPVQMF','','','','justify and reinforce it.','understand and explain it.','expose and discredit it.','demonstrate and criticize it.','sanction and promote it.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','Although the author opens the passage with a hint that she doesn’t like the customary sex roles (“conventions which are at last being questioned”), the rest of the passage is explanatory and analytical. So (C) and (D) are too strong. The answer is (B).','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:24:32','0','0','0','8','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8177','747','Directions: This passage is followed by a group of questions to be answered ... ...','1','','','','','null','76763a1743ec842b3281b86c3e6804ca895c8d66VlcEAFFRAVQFBwdaDAsDU1wHDlJ6F0ZWB18YWlAUDwsFVBNCB1dFB0cMCBYWWlcQQVYQS1lUB0ERWVlDEwJGQglcWVYVQw8RCxEAEDJbSyUbQwxYQkJBSVJfDFRXVBtBEllXF1QKEFAVEVkYWVEFERZDBBAWXEUAFQQXWRdCEl9XFxBMTVcHDxFCGF5AQxZHCVNZWllNRigsYjUQAVwLAlARC1MGEkVZRV8BAA5QUQRTCQgDUAJeDFNSAFwDAg','','','','whether her students learn the material.','what the males in the audience think of her.','how she comes off as a speaker in psychology.','finding a husband.','whether a man challenges her.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','This is an application question; we are asked to apply what we have learned from the passage to a hypothetical situation. The best way to analyze this question is to compare the speaker to a joke-teller. The passage paints a portrait of a woman as most concerned with the image she presents to the world. She is not concerned with the speech or joke, per se, rather with how she delivers it. “Only a man can make a good joke for its own sake.” The answer is (C). Don’t make the mistake of choosing (B). Although men have, in the main, molded her self-image, she has gone beyond that; she now measures herself in the abstract: “how will I come off to the ultimately critical audience?” and not “how will actual audience members see me?”','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:25:07','0','0','0','9','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8178','747','Directions: This passage is followed by a group of questions to be answered ... ...','1','','','','','null','9024e5b1f802e08c93a4db7fd516ae528ca30ec2V1JZA1EHVV0CUgBUAwhRCl1TUAZiDFdBRVAREgMDB0NEVkUQFwJPFxQRV1gHCkZYRQYGAVFUBQlSBANWBFxRAAYBBwJQ','','','','victims','liars','actresses','politicians','ignorant','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','This description question is a bit tricky because the second-best choice is rather good. Women are concerned with the image they present, so they cannot be themselves—they must act their part. Hence the answer is (C). You may have been tempted by (A). According to the passage, women are thrown into the role of an actress, “into the keeping of men.” So, like victims, they are not responsible for their social position. However, nothing in the passage directly suggests that it is wrong for women to be in this position or that women attempt to refuse this role. According to the passage, therefore, women are not, strictly speaking, victims. (Victim means “someone not in control of something injurious happening to him or her.”)','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:25:51','0','0','0','10','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8179','747','Directions: This passage is followed by a group of questions to be answered ... ...','1','','','','','null','39ebc503b3966271bba60eada4c6d90478b74ce7VwwAAQYGAFYFAlVTAAoAA19XDwQhWV9ECABRFBBdBFINE1FRWA9SVRgYAFlRRUBXXVdSRRRTDV1GFVEAFhZQRxEITUg9Mmg7MltbWl9GXlYUTAlSFQNcXl1dRlhaVUFYFUFQDBJaWFIFRFYfEEwNVEVDU0pEB1ZVCwgEVlEEB1EHVggBAAVZU1FVWgRV','','','','A man is defined by what he does, whereas a woman is defined by how she appears.','Men are not image-conscious.','Good looks are more important to women than to men.','undefined','undefined','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','This is an extension question. The passage says, “A man’s presence suggests what he is capable of doing to you or for you,” as opposed to women, whose presence is defined by what seems to be permissible to them. Thus, (A) is true. Furthermore, the passage discusses the fact that a man may fabricate his image (lines 13–14). This suggests that men are conscious of their images, so (B) is not true. The passage also claims that a man’s presence is “always exterior to a man,” whereas “Men survey women before treating them. Consequently how a woman appears to a man can determine how she will be treated.” Thus, (C) is true.','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:26:22','0','0','0','11','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8180','747','Directions: This passage is followed by a group of questions to be answered ... ...','1','','','','','null','718d59b8792ffedb6645a90863a5e5c3ba38be89WgxSAQMGBQAMCAFXAl0HVg4FBgBkC1BBQEpZWVAXSRREQUNEXxUGRlZeE0NYABYUWUsWVFEARg1EE0QKUVoFWQYLUQFUUFMHVlUCDFIDW18','','','','compare and contrast woman’s presence and place in society with that of man’s.','discuss a woman’s presence and place in society and to contrast it with a man’s presence and place.','illustrate how a woman is oppressed by society.','explain why men are better than women at telling jokes.','illustrate how both men and women are hurt by sexism.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','This is a rather hard main idea question because the second-best choice, (A), is quite good. The passage does open with a discussion of a man’s presence. But in paragraph two the pivotal phrase “by contrast” introduces a woman’s presence; from there the discussion of a man’s presence is only in regard to how it affects a woman’s. So a woman’s presence is the main idea; contrasting it with a man’s presence is secondary. (B) gives the proper emphasis to these two purposes.','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:27:11','0','0','0','12','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8181','748','That placebos can cure everything from dandruff to leprosy is well known. ... ...','2','','','','','null','f902459586fff2bccf5e02e1b98527bfc2a72a26WlFUUAtVBlUHA1cDUVxQUQgFUgYxWVtUXRNZCAEZW1UTEF9QQl9aVFUKQg9WURVTVkBHQQAcQRFUQBcGFRFGX1ATWwcNVxRaVwFWFQ1fFUxRABUWWUVGUFRWDFFXAQABCAtRUVFTVFQHUgFUBQsC','','','','Placebo treatment is a proven tool of modern medicine and its expanded use would benefit society’s health.','Because modern technology allows for distribution of drugs on a massive scale, the proven efficacy of the placebo is no longer limited to a privileged few.','The curative power of the placebo is so strong that it should replace proven drugs because the patients receiving the placebo will then be cured without risking any adverse side effects.','The price of placebo treatment must be kept artificially high because patients have little faith in inexpensive treatments.','Semi-placebos—drugs that contain only a small amount of the usual dosage—are even more effective curatives than either the placebo or the full-strength drug.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','As we found by previewing the topic sentences, the passage is about the efficacy of placebo treatment. Careful reading shows that the passage also promotes expanded use of placebos. Hence the answer is (A). The other choices can be quickly dismissed. (B) is the second-best choice: the author does mention that modern distribution techniques can bring the curative power of placebos to everyone, but he does not fully develop that idea. This answer-choice is tempting because it is contained in the topic paragraph. As to (C), it overstates the author’s claim. Although in the third paragraph, the author states that those who receive the placebos may be the lucky ones, this is referring to new, unproven drugs, not to established drugs. As to (D), it, like (B), is mentioned in the passage but is not fully developed. It’s tempting because it appears in the last paragraph—a natural place for the conclusion. Finally, (E) is neither mentioned nor implied by the passage.','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:35:03','0','0','0','1','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8182','748','That placebos can cure everything from dandruff to leprosy is well known. ... ...','2','','','','','null','6d81454a0e2fee7c36c192fa53ba7b28827e8738WwFZBQBVVVIHAAJaVVxWClwEBgY1XAtWWEVZXldEW1NEFl1TQwRWXFRaT1pdUUZfQBALVxIQF1kLU1wMBVsXRhARWRBGDFEVDQZQV0MSS1VLUFZHVlJGX10QElAERFtZFkYQEwNGA1JCBEZYDV0GUwVXBlQCVVsCAA0KBFYOUQUL','','','','Buying a television at a discount house','Making an additional pledge to charity','Choosing the most expensive dishwasher in a manufacturer’s line','Waiting until a book comes out in paperback','Contributing one dollar to the Presidential Campaign fund on your tax return','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','The second item is an application question. The information needed to answer this question is heralded by the pivotal phrase “Even though”. The implication of that sentence is “you get what you pay for.” This would motivate one to buy the most expensive item in a manufacturer’s line. Hence the answer is (C).','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:36:12','0','0','0','2','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8183','748','That placebos can cure everything from dandruff to leprosy is well known. ... ...','2','','','','','null','30703fb74a110cf1d29d9ccb80fabd8f4c45c85fWlBUDgtQBwZRAVUEAAEDBgsOAFN4UAcMQ1YNWlQRTVgURgpdRUVZQUoFUl0UE0MKAF8RElFKFl1cXxZXGV0BFBFWFkFUEVRSUFsBWQkVSldKAVRKW1tREBYRVg9CXEJcU1RQFlZVRBdZV0RHRlNTUldGERgRXV0STQFGTBhXRhcCEVAIUBkKVV5eFlcZQwgCUlcGWxNTXFRVRxFdXFZbUAFUU1laVwwEUVIFU1cBV1I','','','','proper statistical controls should be observed.','this method reduces the risk of maiming too many subjects if the drug should prove to be harmful.','all drugs which are tested would prove to be effective otherwise.','most drugs would test positively otherwise.','the cost of dispensing drugs to all the patients is prohibitive.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','Since this is a description question, you must refer to the passage to answer it. The opening sentence to paragraph two contains the needed information. That sentence states ‘Every drug would prove effective if special steps were not taken to neutralize the placebo effect.” Hence the answer is (C). Choice (D) illustrates why you must refer directly to the passage to answer a description question: unless you have a remarkable memory, you will be unsure whether the statement was that all or that most drugs would prove effective.','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:36:48','0','0','0','3','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8184','748','That placebos can cure everything from dandruff to leprosy is well known. ... ...','2','','','','','null','8ac470969f4d50b7b641ac6d37623967b0ab5b38VwYDBVcCBwcFAQJaBggDUwAHAAB4TRNTVlgQUFUSCA1TXEMTVFUYA0ZdDxMQCVFDQVAVS1NXB0FNWVcREU1bVRdXRUZYXRNDWFBWCUVQW1NQAVUFVlINVQZTVllQBQBSAQ','','','','believe that the benefits of a placebo treatment program that lead patients to believe they were getting a real drug would outweigh the moral issue of lying.','support legislation outlawing the use of placebos.','open up a medical clinic that would treat patients exclusively through placebo methods.','believe that factors other than faith are responsible for the curative power of the placebo.','believe that placebo treatment centers should be tax-exempt because they are nonprofit businesses.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','The answer is (A). One of the first clues to the author’s view on this issue is contained in the pivotal clause “yet the patient . . . effective drug” (lines 31–34). Later, in paragraph six, the author nearly advocates that the patient should not be told that he or she might be receiving a placebo. Finally, the closing line of the passage cinches it. There, the author implies that certain principles can be sacrificed for the greater good of the patients.','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:37:28','0','0','0','4','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8185','748','That placebos can cure everything from dandruff to leprosy is well known. ... ...','2','','','','','null','9d3e5cf2df51f0f1a1e5941c5e2c9a6581d88e57UlBVVQMGVQVXBgFbUAADAV9XDwNgWVBSUBlXW1ZDXAQSTV1dRgQNXV0LQwpeAkYDBkURGQBdEVAUCFsDRBFNWV0ZV0dUAl0LSFhBUQkMQl5XREALVUULABdTF1AFVEJDFARKA1lFXFUYUFYVRwtWQkJYRksHBQcOCFAFAAUAVAJaV1MMXAkGC14EDFE','','','','A general proposition is stated; then evidence for its support is given.','Two types of drug treatment—placebo and non-placebo—are compared and contrasted.','A result is stated, its cause is explained, and an application is suggested.','A dilemma is presented and a possible solution is offered.','A series of examples is presented; then a conclusion is drawn from them.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','In the first paragraph the author claims that placebos can cure everything from dandruff to leprosy—this is a result. Then in paragraphs two, three, four, and five, he explains the causes of the result. Finally, he alludes to an application—the placebo treatment centers. The answer is (C).','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:38:23','0','0','0','5','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8186','748','That placebos can cure everything from dandruff to leprosy is well known. ... ...','2','','','','','null','23dfd624f08dec1c8e8da8dec958baaa3fce5261AgdYAVJbBQYDBwdWA14EUw1VVVRiXgwBWxNdWFVGV1RBTV9dRVBbXA1cTl4PXxYPWEQXFFYFBhRGAhdUWU9FAVtSQFdTEl1ACENSS0VCXFVBUkxDCVdEgLeuEBRWEhEIQBYHVBVCChVSQVYWQApZUQRbWBgRRFFRFV5cWRUHV1pTUgANAl4HAFUCUFdWU1BQBQI','','','','reserved advocacy','feigned objectivity','summary dismissal','perplexed by its effectiveness','zealous promotion','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','This question is a little tricky. Only choices (A) and (B) have any real merit. Although the passage has a detached, third-person style, the author nonetheless does present his opinions—namely that placebos work and that their use should be expanded. However, that advocacy is reserved, so the answer is (A).','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:38:56','0','0','0','6','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8187','748','Directions: This passage is followed by a group of questions to be answered ... ...','2','','','','','null','8853196ac6b4951de387bcfd047bd76afa6f1086VQZXUgNWVlYGAAdRB1xXC1gBUF03XlwWBRQQUFkURxBWBBRBDFxGRldBRQVXUEVRXV4AX0YAUxkVXwdMAVVfUlRVU1pSUQJRXwMCU1UJXgA','','','','it is unjust to exclude people based on their serological status without the knowledge that they pose a danger to the public.','U.S. regulations should require more stringent testing to be implemented at all major border crossings.','it is the responsibility of the public sector to absorb costs incurred by treatment of immigrants infected with HIV.','the HIV pandemic is largely overstated and that, based on new epidemiological data, screening immigrants is not indicated.','only the non-venereal diseases active tuberculosis and infectious leprosy should be listed as dangerous and contagious dis','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','This is a description question. The answer is (A). This is directly supported by the opening sentence of paragraph four. Note that (A) is a paraphrase of that sentence. Be careful with (C). Although this is hinted at, it is never directly stated that the public sector is responsible for these costs, only that it would in fact pick up these costs. Remember: A description question must be answered from what is directly stated in the passage, not from what it implies.','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:43:50','0','0','0','7','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8188','748','Directions: This passage is followed by a group of questions to be answered ... ...','2','','','','','null','c7e74946d2cd762e31134434aa4d3c51e31fc65bVgcDAwsFUVIGCQFQBg9VV18BBQMqQRhVWQ1GVFYTUVpeVkMXAQFBV0dcDxVMDgcWQlgWQVNQUUUSX1ISVwELAlkCUlIAUA0FXQAAAwdTVFM','','','','more than 3 million HIV-positive people have sought permanent residence in the United States.','countries with a low seroprevalence of HIV have a disproportionate and unjustified concern over the spread of AIDS by immigration.','the United States is more concerned with controlling the number of HIV-positive immigrants than with avoiding criticism from outside its borders.','current law is meeting the demand for prudent handling of a potentially hazardous international issue.','actions by countries all over the world to restrict travel are ineffective.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','This is an extension question. The passage states, “U.S. policy has been sharply criticized by national and international organizations.” Given that this criticism has not caused the United States to change its policies, it must be more concerned with controlling the number of HIV-positive immigrants than with avoiding criticism. The answer, therefore, is (C).','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:44:27','0','0','0','8','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8189','748','Directions: This passage is followed by a group of questions to be answered ... ...','2','','','','','null','5d577e93231f0fb4a9a5a7a40eda969d8b727886UFVVDgJUBQJXAlABUQkDUF8DBwZiDgcYQAxFVEXS4q1AEAsUWExbWVAVXVvTt6tGAkEUFhZUBkIPWxEXXgNCSFYQRFECVUJSUQxEBlVGQxhRBBRcVFFfCAZWFAIWUFUDUgVUB1dfVAFTW1UHVwdaCQY','','','','medicinal','protective','judicious','costly','experimental','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','This is a description question. Even if you know the meaning of the word, don’t assume that your definition of it is the one the test is looking for. Read the sentence around it: “We support well-funded programs to protect the health of travelers infected with HIV through appropriate immunizations and prophylactic treatment and to reduce behaviors that may transmit infection.” The phrase “immunizations and prophylactic treatment” indicates that “prophylactic” should be similar in meaning to “immunization.” Furthermore, we can see that the word must “reduce behaviors that may transmit infection.” The best definition, then, is (B) protective.','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:45:12','0','0','0','9','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8190','748','Directions: This passage is followed by a group of questions to be answered ... ...','2','','','','','null','b262a2bc661507b119062aa01789020e33cb2c50VQFYVQMAAgIABwYBVg9ZBgACA1YjUlMOEQEXFVEBE3hRVVVGFXEOA1hRVAZeFxEPWhdTWloAFBRKUUNWDxdRBBANUA9YEFZUFF1RRlBREANFFU4GQgYRCl1EFgYGF1lHGVZQWg9QFQICEUQEGQJcQhRdXVtMWQ0BFlxUDlkEQwdAXg0NTBdvURlXVF1BVFoPAAhCBVxEVUJbVBhBXVVDFldGSgJXBhESXFYWUQNWCAUODAwDUwdQUlAHVVNaUQM','','','','the authors agree fully with this policy but disagree with adding HIV to the list.','the authors believe that sexual diseases are appropriate reasons for denying immigration but not non-venereal diseases.','the authors disagree with the amendment.','the authors believe that non-venereal diseases are justifiable reasons for exclusion, but not sexually transmitted diseases.','the authors believe that no diseases should be cause for denying immigration.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','This is another extension question. The passage states that those carrying diseases should not be barred admission “unless they posed a danger to the community through casual transmission.” We expect that they would oppose adding HIV to the list. The answer is (C).','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:45:59','0','0','0','10','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8191','748','Directions: This passage is followed by a group of questions to be answered ... ...','2','','','','','null','64b37570eace1e8db491638173b06501de35eed3VQVSBVUHAlIHBVEGVQtZAVsHAgZ/WkFBV1BQEEVfXlMUEA4WRFsDF9Sxr1AJF0VF0bWoRAhdW0YQQ1EHFlYYE0ZeUEJHQ1JYXQdNFkRbAxdXREdbCRZCFlJFRQUTVlZHDkgUDlNVDwUBDgRVBFQAAgFUUFJVAFNSU1UA','','','','financial costs.','costs to the public health.','costs in manpower.','costs in international reputation.','costs in public confidence.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','Although governments have ostensibly restricted the immigration of HIV-positive persons out of fear that they may spread the disease, the authors apparently are referring to financial costs, not costs to public health. This is indicated in paragraph four, where they describe heart disease and cancer as non-contagious and costly, yet still admissible. The answer, therefore, is (A).','','','','','','2012-01-26 16:47:00','0','0','0','11','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8192','749','A more admirable character would have been one who overcame his ( ________ ... ...','5','3452a8bde6f6ff642bd9c4845abbcb396a6946e8VVFUUgdTCwcMBAdWVwAAU1xQDwEQAlFeUFFZVgBXUAJfBVAOWFEDAA4','','','','null','','','','','ire','depraved','evil','intensity','patience','sophistication','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','cf','The writer is pointing out that one who overcomes evil is more admirable than one who is born simple, lacking the sophistication to be bad.','','','','','','2012-01-27 11:20:26','1','0','0','2','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8193','750','Despite receiving approbation for his work several times that year, Tim ... ...','1','','Unlike other GRE questions that ask you to select multiple answers, for these questions, you know how many answers you are looking for — two. So, we can use a very effective process-of-elimination strategy.','','','null','6e2bb0b6fd1e1654011b8f030deb71f5f440a649AgVQBAJbAFZRAFAHVwkCBABSDlJ0VhJGX0RdRUUHAgEKFFhWAUVRFBFDXlBQTFpdCxBSChERC19KRE9YQlhBRVNGXRdWDkEQCg9US0YRWAUVEUhXUEofEjFZWUUFVA9CGTtnaG9sPmlpEFkHWBcVRAsLQhgMClJECF8RRlldE1QJX0ELB1QRX1cDGFJTXA9ZW0kWXVFSUlQHB1MPVwMFAlUFAVMHDAo','','','','confident','anxious','apprehensive','stoic','amenable','secure','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','bc','If you feel confident that you have fully comprehended the sentence, come up with your own word to fit the blank, and eliminate answer choices that are not similar in meaning to your word. For this example, you might come up with a word like “unsure” or “insecure” to fill in the blank. Then, you could eliminate (A) and (F), which are the opposite of unsure, and (D) and (E), which also do not mean “unsure.” This would leave you with the correct answer choices (B) and (C).','','','','','','2012-01-27 12:46:41','0','0','0','1','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8194','750','Life, as the film demonstrates, is too complex for ________ endings.','1','e0819e32ac5f48d1684bb303b7d28d5da39f4c12U1BWVVcCV1NQUwAEBVtUUA4OAQEYBwcIBQcDVAddXAZVWFEJUwVbCQI','','','','null','8246e74a7624a365ef658adf9d0e0728c5693781BwNUAAJbBFVXUQUBBAAEB1tXBVJ6W1dVShNZShlBXgMSB18KVRdUUAlYW0VFSlZFBhJNQ1lLRUENDhNUWV9BXANLGF9WRxY5bT5pOWdobxUBWVFfX19EH1sABQUJXFVQUlYBD1UHBwlVBAAI','','','','intricate','facile','ambiguous','occult','straightforward','recognizable','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','be','The sentence for this example is pretty clear; we can confidently conclude that the blank must mean something close to “easy” or “simple,” if life is too complex for it. (A) intricate does not mean “easy” or “simple,” so eliminate it. (B) facile does mean easy, so keep it. (C) ambiguous and (D) occult do not mean “easy,” so eliminate them. (E) straightforward is close to “easy” or “simple,” so keep it. (F) recognizable does not mean either word, so eliminate it. This effectively leaves us with our two correct answer choices — (B) and (E).','','','','','','2012-01-27 12:47:47','0','0','0','2','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8195','750','LOOK FOR PAIRSHowever, you may not always entirely understand the sentence, ... ...','1','f5e2455377b206fcd6a8299b881e7215513340edVAZXU1EHAwACBV0HDVpYAFpXVVMZU1wKVAAJVFFSBAJUAVUEVg0HA1M','LOOK FOR PAIRS

However, you may not always entirely understand the sentence, so you may not feel confident about the word you come up with to fit the blank. In these instances, you can still use process of elimination.

It can be daunting to think of finding two correct answers out of six. However, by using a simple process-of-elimination strategy, you can instead usually decide between one answer out of two.

How? ETS gives us the answer. They ask you to produce completed sentences that are “alike in meaning.” In other words, you are looking for answers that are synonymous or closely related to each other. So, you can confidently eliminate any answer choices that don’t match up with any of the other answer choices — the lone rangers.

Eliminate carefully, however. “Alike” does not necessarily mean identical. If you think two answer choices are related, it’s best not to eliminate them for now.

Frequently (thought not always), for each question there will be two sets of synonyms and two lone rangers. By eliminating the lone rangers, you have essentially narrowed it down to two options — one set of synonyms or another.

','','','null','e7a62bc93d229c6fd59db8f3dc79e531708a370eUAcDBAdRAVYNUgAGBw9TAw4BAwYyWFxFUFFYFlsRRQBcEF0BFU1bVxNSEEZdUV5XSkIXCxNobW5oaGo8ORBNDVRBEQpRQw0DQAxHBEFcVxJHXEJCRltcRhkWDAFeGVAJUQRRAFEJXFAGBAZSDAJWUQMA','','','','positive','circuitous','provocative','inflammatory','improbable','archaic','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','cd','In this example, there are myriad words that could fit the blank, so coming up with your own word may not be the most effective strategy. However, we can look for pairs of similar words among the answer choices to give us some guidance. (A) positive does not have any related words among the other choices, so we can eliminate it as a lone ranger. (B) circuitous is also a lone ranger (though if you are unsure of the definition, don’t eliminate this one yet). (C) provocative and (D) inflammatory are closely related, so we’ll hang onto that set of synonyms. (E) improbable, though it suits the sentence, does not have a related word, so it can be eliminated. So can (F), archaic. In this example, there is only one set of synonyms. Let’s put both of the words back into the sentence to make sure they make sense and give the sentence similar meaning. They do, so we can feel confident about choosing (C) and (D).','','','','','','2012-01-27 12:54:35','0','0','0','3','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8196','750','USE TRANSITIONAL WORDS AND APPOSITION','1','ffe1defcc6d7c214f512c7ce01e453f29bb7e226UAFWBAQCBFZVCFMHVlkFUF8FUgBaQBZQVhQBXlJDSltABl8dAxcKWkBBRV1ZBglnMn0XMTAgKjEvZy0qKHIqEW97MHZgEHgoJkRxNWJ6Zy9nfHh8C05ERhNXWQJcXUsRFlIKWwUEBVQIBQcGBgNfVFsGUlJXBwZQ','','','','null','','','','','containment','pacification','capitulation','appeasement','apathy','defamation','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','bd','Notice the key transitional word, “instead.” So, we can deduce that the “policy of ________” must be in opposition to “taking a severe stand against him.” The opposite of being severely against someone would be being kind or indulgent to them. A policy of (A) containment is not indulgent, so it can be eliminated. (B) pacification is a possibility. (C) capitulation, or surrender, is a possibility. (D) appeasement is also an option. (E) apathy, or demonstrating no emotion, does not fit, so it can be eliminated. (F) defamation, or slander, can also be eliminated. Among answers (B), (C), and (D), (B) and (D) give the sentence the most similar meaning. The correct answer is (B) and (D).','','','','','','2012-01-27 13:06:32','0','0','0','4','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8197','750','The writer of the scandalous magazine article exposing the indiscretions ... ...','1','109e5486a5db2363b79e8b34c625898ee7d6362aBwUADwQHCgIEVgUAAAEEA1tXA1AZWwALUgFTBldaDVxWAwMBAwcABQU','','','','null','','','','','reproach','acclaim','avarice','censure','adumbration','commendation','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','ad','If you are confident in your understanding of the sentence and all of its vocabulary, then you can effectively come up with your own word to fill in the blank. You might come up with “negative feedback” or “criticism.” Then, you can eliminate answer choices (B), (C), (E), and (F), and you are left with answers (A) and (D). Another process of elimination tactic you might have taken is to look for pairs of synonyms among the answer choices. Even if you are not sure of the definition of (C) avarice or (D) adumbration, you should be able to spot that (A) reproach and (D) censure are synonymous as well as (B) acclaim and (F) commendation. Since there are usually two sets of synonyms that have opposite meanings of each other, you should still be able to eliminate answers (C) and (D). If you aren’t sure of the meaning of “ambivalent” (if so, look it up in the vocabulary section), then the signal word you should spot is “both.” Since “admiration,” “acclaim,” and “commendation” are all fairly similar in meaning, it would be redundant to use two of them in this context. So, the blank must mean something different from “admiration.” The answer, then, is (A) reproach and (D) censure. Finally, you might also recognize the use of apposition in this sentence. As there is no transitional word following the semi-colon, “she was subject both admiration and ______” modifies or defines an “ambivalent reaction.” If you know the meaning of ambivalent (having confliction emotions), then you know that the blank should be a conflicting emotion to “admiration.” This would be (A) reproach and (D) censure.','','','','','','2012-01-27 13:07:45','0','0','0','5','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8198','750','Though in acting circles he has a reputation of being a consummate professional, ... ...','1','7c472b9d9d4fd438ec0b2ba2431a577b33a1331aVQFYBgdWAFNQUVYEAQsHAVoOBl0XBVJRUARQBVIFAg5XUQsHAwJVV1c','','','','null','592ee2cbe437e873f9346d8007f74c1cd4342b0cAlBZDwdUVlUNUwdbB1tVAg0GD1JkDgpGVl8YXwoZVlFNXlYFQgFREQIIXUoUXwARUQIQGVJDRlVERU1WRA8KXRFYXhYGXF5cXhdZQgENVhAUCVVYQFJFQUsMBVxAEF1fWlFVGxAHERNFXlVTFxlfVxlUWQxCAF1DEBFRTVEXOm5mPDxmbDxrb2sQVlkQEg1WEURMVwNcGQRdDwhSVQQPVwJVW10ABFEDW1MA','','','','jocund','efficient','playful','adept','aloof','stern','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','ac','Assuming you understand the sentence, first come up with your own word to fit the blank. One would expect a professional to behave seriously, so you might come up with “silly” to fit the blank. (A) jocund and (C) playful are synonymous to silly, while all the others can be effectively eliminated. However, perhaps your word for the blank was something more along the lines of “unprofessional.” None of the answer choices would be the clear match for this word, in which case, we should use process of elimination to find pairs of words among the answers. (A) jocund and (C) playful are similar, so keep them. (E) aloof and (F) stern are somewhat related. (B) efficient and (D) adept are our lone rangers. Now, both sets of synonyms could arguably fit within the sentence, so let’s reexamine both sets to see which set gives the sentence the most similar meaning when both answer choices are plugged in to the blank. (E) aloof and (F) stern give the sentence different meanings, so the answer is (A) and (C). If you struggled to understand the sentence, recognize the signal word “though” at the beginning. This key word clues you in to a contradiction between “professional” and the blank. Thus, since “professional” has a positive connotation, the blank should be negative. This can help you narrow down the answer choices.','','','','','','2012-01-27 13:08:47','0','0','0','6','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8199','749','Before You Look at The Answer Choices, Think of a Word That “Fits” ... ...','3','9e5b22b4cd66cda1f5cdf78fb626a5c7d0cf3ec0WgwFD1BTUVUHBQJVDQ5WAFgHB1BFXwUOUgAECgMCUwUPBgFVU1ZXBQk','Before You Look at The Answer Choices, Think of a Word That “Fits” The Sentence

Don’t worry about coming up with a fancy or erudite word for the blank. As a matter of fact, you can make up your own word, as long as you know what it means. Then, go through the answer choices and eliminate ones that don’t match your word. If none of them match your word, revisit the sentence to make sure you’ve understood it.

','','','null','0385a493e41c0fd2bc40fb58b1d2b5a6e237171bWlAFAAdSAgAFAVFSBg9ZBQ5SDlF6EFxAQANYD1pVWREDGBNRUEdaWV5EAFlaVBEUXl5HXEsXV1kXEFBRGSVrdhhFahZFUVkRAwRUWF8RR1gZFRFTR0VYC18RXVVAF1lVXghRQFAHSh0ULVwRFkNSXQdMUFZfV1pTXAoHUxRGUBcRbmpvbWhnaGhKXlYMWlsCUFdbVlcGUgNSVgIOAFM','','','','appeased','destroyed','placated','elevated','sustained','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','If somebody is crestfallen (despairing) and has begun to question herself, then her self-confidence would be “shot.” “Appeased,” “placated,” “elevated,” and “sustained” don’t mean shot, but “destroyed” certainly does. Hence, the answer is “destroyed.”','','','','','','2012-01-27 13:21:46','0','0','0','3','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8200','749','Although the warring parties had settled a number of disputes, past experience ... ...','3','','','','','null','','','','','rash','ambivalent','scornful','overjoyed','reticent','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','e','“Although” sets up a contrast between what has occurred—success on some issues—and what can be expected to occur—success for the whole talks. Hence, the parties are reluctant to express optimism. The common word “reluctant” is not offered as an answer-choice, but a synonym—reticent—is.','','','','','','2012-01-27 13:24:46','0','0','0','4','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8201','749','Rather than increasing its security by developing nuclear weapons, a nascent ... ...','3','','','','','null','','','','','benefactor','protector','target','patron','non entity','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','The phrase “rather than” sets up a contrast between what a country hopes to achieve by developing nuclear weapons (increased security) and what it actually achieves (becoming a target). The answer is “target.”','','','','','','2012-01-27 13:25:50','0','0','0','5','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8202','749','Support IndicatorsSupporting words support or further explain what has ... ...','3','','','','','null','4c64561ff106ab918b11e9039788e3861fbe4f9eAQxXBgdbUFUFAFRSBApQAw1XVwQIF0wRXFpVXHRNVAxCXwYDXhZKFhBXWFcKBAFDDz06dFFEWEIUCBJBVQoYDENEQA1TR1wOR0BDWAxdGT09Z2lva2c8EUJAVVFbV0MdFAQQFFUIVBoTV1MXQkFcAhJHDE4DS11CBEpfVVpcQ15DEFZfVdCxpVVBFRNBARgARkZfF1VSUA5cHQYAUgoAVVoAUwMMDlJXU1UEVglX','','','','lofty','vituperative','unstinting','retiring','laudatory','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','“And” in the sentence indicates that the missing adjective is similar in meaning to “opprobrious,” which is very negative. Now, vituperative—the only negative word—means “abusive.”','','','','','','2012-01-27 13:27:52','0','0','0','6','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8203','749','The belief that sanctions and tactical military strikes can turn the people ... ...','3','','','','','null','','','','','sometimes','rarely','invariably','never','occasionally','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','“Indeed” in the sentence indicates that the second clause supports and emphasizes what is stated in the first clause: that sanctions and tactical military strikes will not work. Now, something that will not work will invariably (always) fail.','','','','','','2012-01-27 13:30:21','0','0','0','7','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8204','749','Because the Senate has the votes to override a presidential veto, the President ... ...','3','','','','','null','e5b6bc584316ac008325223d8bd0c24195033279VQwCUFZQClxWA1QEAgBXBgkBUF0PFUZLDF9UDSdBAlhDDwYNCRZBQ0RXDQFbD1tKXD46JFNbV0FDUkZMWwMSagZfUkcHGQtUQEMXX1AZRFhCXRBGEVwZVxRWQhRfXFMUURcWSlYVW10GX0daA1VDQ1YXDBsVTVpSFmgRAxZaXV0MRxAOV0sWWl8XBVBcD1FcQ1NGR0JNDBVsPDxoamZtaBgKUVUBC1tcUlACUgcBAwQDBFQPCg','','','','object','abdicate','abstain','capitulate','compromise','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','e','Since the Senate has the votes to pass the bill or motion, the President would be wise to compromise and make the best of the situation.','','','','','','2012-01-27 13:32:49','0','0','0','8','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8205','749','A Note on Multiple Blank QuestionsSo far, we have applied the strategies ... ...','3','','','','','null','','','','','asserts','renounces','enumerates','obligated','inept','provoked','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','bd','The transitional word “instead” sets up a contradiction that is essential. Focus on the phrase “claiming instead that truth is to be found...”. So, Socrates renounces the reality of the physical world. Reread the first sentence now with “renounces” in the first blank. With the first sentence completed, one can read the entire passage and determine that Socrates has a positive view of philosophers, so he would likely believe that philosophers, or enlightened men, “should” or are obligated to guide the unenlightened. Rereading the passage, each of the answer choices makes sense in the passage as a whole.','','','','','','2012-01-27 13:39:20','0','0','0','9','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8206','749','Robert Williams’ style of writing has an air of ________: just when you ... ...','3','','HINT: If a comma is not followed by a linking word—such as and, for, yet—then the following phrase is probably appositional.','','','null','','','','','ineptness','indignation','reserve','jollity','capriciousness','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','e','There is no connecting word following the colon. Hence, the description, “just when you think the story line is predictable, he suddenly takes a different direction,” defines the missing word. Now, something that is unpredictable because it’s continually changing direction is capricious. Thus, the answer is “capriciousness.”','','','','','','2012-01-27 13:41:49','0','0','0','10','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8207','751','As Xenophanes recognized as long ago as the sixth century before Christ, ... ...','2','','','','','null','8b7bf65a6ca4b062fb17cfb88012fbe7355f6538AQJVD1cBAFIMAlFVBAlYUVoCUgMwWFESWlVbXEQPAFMCQw5QE0YNA0JGVUoXA1RTGFtGF0RZWBcAUgZeXAAFAFFWVwVXU1FQVVZSDg','','','','Olympic mythology evolved from ancient rituals and gave rise to early philosophy','early moves toward viewing nature as ordered by divine and universal law coincided with monotheistic impulses and the disintegration of classical mythology','early philosophy followed from classical mythology','the practice of science, i.e., empiricism, preceded scientific theory','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','

Most main idea questions are rather easy. This one is not—mainly, because the passage itself is not an easy read. Recall that to find the main idea of a passage, we check the last sentence of the first paragraph; if it’s not there, we check the closing of the passage. Reviewing the last sentence of the first paragraph, we see that it hardly presents a statement, let alone the main idea. Turning to the closing line of the passage, however, we find the key to this question. The passage describes a struggle for ascendancy amongst four opposing philosophies: (magic and traditional rites) vs. (Olympic mythology) vs. (monotheism [Zeus]) vs. (early philosophy and science). The closing lines of the passage summarize this and add that Olympic mythology lost out to monotheism (Zeus), while magical cults enjoyed a revival and the germ of universal law was planted. Thus the answer is (B).

As to the other choices, (A) is false. “Olympic mythology [arose] on one hand and early philosophy and science on the other” (closing to paragraph two); thus they initially developed in parallel. (C) is also false. It makes the same type of error as (A). Finally, (D) is not mentioned in the passage.

','','','','','','2012-01-27 14:25:41','0','0','0','1','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8208','751','If dynamic visual graphics, sound effects, and automatic scorekeeping are ... ...','2','','','','','null','','','','','Watching the computer stage a battle between two opponents','Controlling a character in battle against a computer','Challenging another player to a battle in a non-cooperative two-person game','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','ab','A, True: Stimulation would occur. This choice is qualitatively the same as passively watching violence on television. B, True: Stimulation would also occur. This is another example of solitary aggression. C, False: No stimulation would occur. Two-player aggressive games are “cathartic.”
You will frequently see select-in questions in this category. Answering these questions requires the same thought-process as other description questions — finding the relevant sentence(s) of the passage and narrowing down the information to the most directly pertinent. For select-in passage questions, however, instead of looking for the best restatement of the information you have found, you must instead highlight the actual passage.','','','','','','2012-01-27 14:30:47','0','0','0','2','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8209','751','The technical phenomenon, embracing all the separate techniques, forms ... ...','2','','','','','null','6f615629735c51a472c0720973645c7493f5f1adAgVXDwZbVwJSU1cGUltXBV8AD1JgDlUYhuP9FlRUDVlQW1ZcGEFQUw9eW1xbVwqE5v4TFgMFU0UUU10XQAkQUQpDFQpUFwpHXFZeXl8RVF8PVBZaVFZEBAMQR0QEBhZTA1BQWVECEFkXVFNSCABWAQ0NVAcMCAtQVFcHWFE','','','','all of the machinery in use today','the abstract idea of the machine','a way of thinking in modern society','what all machines have in common','undefined','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','(A): No, it is clear from the passage that the technical phenomenon is more abstract than that, since it is described in the opening paragraph as uniting all the separate “techniques” (not machines) and as comprising the “features” that such things as an office and an aircraft have in common. (B): No, the passage states that the technical phenomenon is something that includes both techniques and their use (See closing lines of the passage); it is thus broader that just the idea of machinery. (C): Yes, this seems to be the best answer; it is broad enough to include both techniques and their uses and abstract enough to go beyond talking only about machines. (D): No, the passage suggests that it is something that techniques have in common and techniques can include airplanes or offices.','','','','','','2012-01-27 14:33:13','0','0','0','3','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8210','751','Thirdly, I worry about the private automobile. It is a dirty, noisy, wasteful, ... ...','2','','','','','null','85cd485e3ed1ba0f44368fad91ca37e2f34fcbb7VANXAgMFA1xQAFBRAgkAAwgEU1E2C15bXRBfXhMXWFNGVV5UDl9GDVlQFlZVFUQYAFVHUERYA1RCEhFcBENYSlJRXlFJAkRfCV0RVwQQRQxSF0ZVQxVRXwEPDFVXVVgAUlNWAwRRUQsBVlNaUVQ','','','','A problem is presented and then a possible solution is discussed.','The benefits and demerits of the automobile are compared and contrasted.','A topic is presented and a number of its effects are discussed.','A set of examples is furnished to support a conclusion.','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','This passage is laden with effects. Kennan introduces the cause, the automobile, in the opening sentence and from there on presents a series of effects—the automobile pollutes, enslaves, and so on. Hence the answer is (C). Note: (D) is the second-best choice; two flaws disqualify it. First, in this context, “examples” is not as precise as “effects.” Second, the order is wrong: the conclusion, “I worry about the private automobile” is presented first and then the examples: it pollutes, it enslaves, etc.','','','','','','2012-01-27 14:34:41','0','0','0','4','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8211','751','The idea of stuff expresses no more than the experience of coming to a ... ...','2','','','','','null','79efbb2781b4065b77a05776e09129b448125b0eVgBSVVZUA1ENBlIADA5VC11QD1NlDlEWRV0KU0JERAkDQxECEEdWUlAUQBYCUFVGTRZXAFdDQBkQDlwWRg5VDwAZClAREFgERgEODAgUUUdaWRMUDV5TXRlfQkJRRRRcHAVcREISVQZaDFIBBwEAWFdRWAFXAA8EBwFRUwA','','','','The book attempts to understand psychotherapy in the context of different and changing systems of thought.','The book argues that psychotherapy unites elements of an exact science with elements of eastern philosophy.','The book describes the origins of psychotherapy around the world.','The book compares psychotherapy in the West and in the East.','undefined','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','(A): Yes, this is the most accurate inference from the passage. The passage discusses how the more carefully a scientist views and describes something the more he describes the environment in which it moves, and the passage traces similarities between psychotherapy and Eastern systems of (evolving) thought. (B): No, this is too narrow an interpretation of what the whole book would be doing. (C): No, too vague; the passage is too philosophical to be merely a history. (D): No, also too vague, meant to entrap those of you who relied on the title without thinking through the passage.','','','','','','2012-01-27 14:51:00','0','0','0','5','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8212','751','An elm in our backyard caught the blight this summer and dropped stone ... ...','2','','','','','null','ffff1c542af7dd6369716625b81fd33b38ccb24aWgFUBFJaA1RXVlFTB1tZCwpTVVFnCg1QCxQLXgBEWgNCRwwDQlReXFVaQlsPXhBHDBNZVRMBXUpHRQBcURAFUBdRFlkfARURClZEBxdGWV9L17WrEhlRRBcPQURXBhhNXBICRlRCEFsGFBZVCQVBDA1dFw4LQhFSXEFCVwRXEEACD1sRUg1cGVcAAkBYXVIFUQEGCFQCUVZRUVdeAVFTAg1U','','','','Dismay at the inherent cruelty of nature','Amusement at the irony of the relationship between pain and death','Admiration for the ways in which animal life functions in the ecosystem','A desire to conduct experiments on animals in order to discover more about the relationship between pain and death','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','The author’s attitude toward the relationship between pain and death evolves through three stages. First, he expresses revulsion at the relationship. This is indicated in the second paragraph by the words “wince” and “abomination.” Then in the third paragraph, he adopts a more analytical attitude and questions his previous judgment. This is indicated by the clause, “I wonder if his dying is necessarily all that different from the passing of our elm.” And in closing the paragraph, he seems resigned to the fact the relationship is not all that bad. This is indicated by the sentence, “If a mouse could shrug, he’d shrug.” Finally, in the last paragraph, he comes to express admiration for the relationship between pain and death. This is indicated by the phrase “wonderfully precise and quick,” and it is made definite by the closing line, “If I had to design an ecosystem . . . in which dying was an indispensable part of living, I could not think of a better way to manage.” Thus, the answer is (C).','','','','','','2012-01-27 14:52:26','0','0','0','6','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8213','726','[Select One or More Answer Choices]','5','397c1d3a8b824b6824065905dbf5798f16d62c2cVAxRAlZaBlIFVVIBUglWAFsAB1ZrZFYOVVZMQn8NXBVcShIpXkJcRXZWQ0MASxV1WQpfAANCagdbBgRXUlEGVQkNXlMGBw8HUApR','Substitution is a very useful technique for solving GRE math problems. It often reduces hard problems to routine ones. In the substitution method, we choose numbers that have the properties given in the problem and plug them into the answer-choices. A few examples will illustrate.
[Select One or More Answer Choices]','','','null','03363600fbfdd26388464bef945a388cd2de0befAFZUUlAFBgBVCFAAUFxWAQsPAFAqBRcNVgkJWgsbVg8IEVwSFFBWGQwGUUQKCEEBBl1GTkQTX1pRURZaDQYXXlVEQ1xSFFUNWl1aFl1fXxkKERUFDUZQEgRWFAsKEFJUV0sJCUwTCTw5aT0IRxRQDldCRlwWQVlLAlcXWlcEUAJYDAEDV1wPUFYLUlBTAVJX','','','','   n3','   n/4','   2n + 3','   n(n + 3)

','   ','   2n − 4','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','df','We are told that n is an odd integer. So choose an odd integer for n, say, 1 and substitute it into each answer-choice. Now, n3 becomes 13 = 1, which is not an even integer, so eliminate (A). Next, n/4 = 1/4 is not an even integer—eliminate (B). Next, 2n + 3 = 2 · 1 + 3 = 5 is not an even integer—eliminate (C). Next, n(n + 3) = 1(1 + 3) = 4 is even and hence is at least one of the answers. Next, = = 1, which is not even—eliminate (E). Finally, 2n − 4 = 2(1) − 4 = −2, which is even and therefore is another answer. Thus, the answer consists of choices (D) and (F).
• When using the substitution method, be sure to check every answer-choice because the number you choose may work for more than one answer-choice. If this does occur, then choose another number and plug it in, and so on, until you have eliminated all but the answers. This may sound like a lot of computing, but the calculations can usually be done in a few seconds.','','','','','','2012-01-27 15:03:13','0','0','0','1','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8214','726','[Numeric Entry Question]','5','27153af225110424e93cd14dcc4fc394d84e3c89UAwAAApXUFFRBlMADQAFUQhUAQZreUVVV0VQVBh8X0NDHBQ1QVxHFlpXD2tdBVdRBlUDBFoLXVdVWgMGA1QIAQ','Defined functions are very common on the GRE, and most students struggle with them. Yet once you get used to them, defined functions can be some of the easiest problems on the test. In this type of problem, you will be given a strange symbol and a property that defines the symbol. Some examples will illustrate.','','','null','','','','','1','2','3','4','5','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','c','From the above definition, we know that x∇y = xy − y. So all we have to do is replace x with 2 and y with 3 in the definition: 2∇3 = 2 · 3 − 3 = 3. Hence, enter 3 in the box.','','','','','','2012-01-27 15:08:23','0','0','0','2','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8215','726','When the integer n is divided by 2, the quotient is u and the remainder ... ...','5','9196df381262a84fdf59ab396c3e24b80e1fc45dUVcCBAZVUgJWUwVXDVxTBQpQVQESUFcGCFAHCwdXBFJaB1RTVlIEBlY','

This broad category is a popular source for GRE questions. At first, students often struggle with these problems since they have forgotten many of the basic properties of arithmetic. So before we begin solving these problems, let’s review some of these basic properties.

• “The remainder is r when p is divided by q” means p = qz + r; the integer z is called the quotient. For instance, “The remainder is 1 when 7 is divided by 3” means 7 = 3 · 2 + 1.','','','null','','','','','2u + 5v = 4','2u − 5v = 2','4u + 5v = 2','4u − 5v = 2','3u − 5v = 2','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','b','','','Translating “When the integer n is divided by 2, the quotient is u and the remainder is 1” into an equation gives

n = 2u + 1

Translating “When the integer n is divided by 5, the quotient is v and the remainder is 3” into an equation gives

n = 5v + 3

Since both expressions equal n, we can set them equal to each other:

2u + 1 = 5v + 3

Rearranging and then combining like terms yields

2u − 5v = 2

The answer is (B).

','','','','2012-01-27 15:11:41','0','0','0','3','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8216','726','[Select One or More Answer Choices]','5','199543658d64996b512a332882951f609feac563Wg1QUgJTAAYGAFZTBV4HBAFUAFM+alBbXFMSQ3cPBhIKShF+XhNWFHhXQhNUQhMhWl9bUlQVOwULUA4OVwAABl8GVlpeBAJRUA4C','','','','null','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','ac','For a fractional expression to be an integer, the denominator must divide evenly into the numerator. Now, Choice (A) cannot be an integer. Since q is odd and p is even, p + q is odd. Further, since p + q is odd, it cannot be divided evenly by the even number p. Hence, cannot be an integer. Next, Choice (B) can be an integer. For example, if p = 2 and q = 3, then Finally, Choice (C) cannot be an integer. p2 = p · p is even since it is the product of two even numbers. Further, since q is odd, it cannot be divided evenly by the even integer p2. Thus, the answer consists of choices (A) and (C).

','','','','','','2012-01-27 15:13:12','0','0','0','4','0');

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8217','726','Column Ax ≥ 1Column Bx10 x100','5','7b4bc2d3d437555768654916ac1c6abf80aae180UwVVAQMGV1BRAFdTAAxSAAlUUlcQAl0EUABXVVAHV1cFW1MEUlBXDQA','','','','null','','','','','Column A is larger','Column B is larger','The columns are equal','There is not enough information to decide','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','d','','','','','One would expect x100 to be larger than x10. But this is a hard problem and therefore what we expect will not be the answer. Now, clearly x100 cannot always be less than x10. And just as clearly x100 cannot always be equal to x10. Hence, the answer is (D)—not-enough-information. (A double case can also be obtained by substituting x = 1 and then x = 2.)','','2012-01-27 15:18:39','0','0','0','5','0');

Each side of a triangle is shorter than the sum of the lengths of the other two sides, and, at the same time, longer than the difference of the two. Since only choices (C) and (D) lie between the values 8 and 16, the answers are (C) and (D).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8222','726','If p and q are positive, p2 + q2 = 16, and p2 – q2 = 8, then q =','5','c78abc37cc92edb03b65d6e37a4c399345e43126VQwCAQFSAFcHBl0AAVkHCg1XVwFCXQFUVwMEUQZRAA5XVwQGBgUJVAA','','','','null','','','','','   2

Subtract the second equation from the first:

p2 + q2 = 16

 

(–) p2 – q2 = 8

 

2q2 = 8

Dividing both sides of the equation by 2 gives

Finally, taking the square root of both sides gives

q = ±2

Hence, the answer is (A).

insert into iphone_questions(id,ex_app_id,name,difficulty,text_block1a,text_block1b,text_block1c,text_block1d,image,question_stem_a,question_stem_b,question_stem_c,question_stem_d,answer1_a,answer2_a,answer3_a,answer4_a,answer5_a,answer6_a,answer1_b,answer2_b,answer3_b,answer4_b,answer5_b,answer1_c,answer2_c,answer3_c,answer4_c,answer5_c,answer1_d,answer2_d,answer3_d,answer4_d,answer5_d,hint1,video2,video1,solution,solution_text,solution_text1,solution_text2,solution_text3,solution_text4,solution_text5,date,idx,pt_id,pt_section,pt_qid,pt_group_first) values('8224','726','In a legislative body of 200 people, the number of Democrats is 50 less ... ...','5','bf488bfabb52cf055e9b870fa616247a0a32f073VA1ZUFUABF1XAQJTBAsFB11VDlEUXlZRBFZQCFMHAQMHCVkHCgVWBwQ','','','','null','','','','','42','50','71','95','124','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','','a','Let D be the number of Democrats and let R be the number of Republicans. \"One fifth of the legislators are neither Republican nor Democrat,\" so there are · 200 = 40 legislators who are neither Republican nor Democrat. Hence, there are 200 – 40 = 160 Democrats and Republicans, or D + R = 160. Translating the clause \"the number of Democrats is 50 less than 4 times the number of Republicans\" into an equation yields D = 4R – 50. Plugging this into the equation D + R = 160 yields

4R – 50 + R = 160

5R – 50 = 160

5R = 210

R = 42

The answer is (A).

','','','','','','2012-01-27 15:43:47','0','0','0','12','0');
